reviewText:
I gave  2K15 a good review and that was after a couple Patches that made the game usable. 2K16 came around and it's the same engine, basically the same game but with a ton more flaws and issues and i don't know how that is even possible. I mean in 2K15 for example the Lakers had their real arena light, that means, all the lights on court while the crowd area is darkend. In 2K16 it's the same bright lit arena like everywhere.

But that's just one of the more superficial flaws this game has.
So far i encountered:
- During Games the commentators stop working, that was a problem in 2K15 but is even worse here now with the commentators stop all the time, in every match be it a mycareer match, a online match, myteam match, all the time
- Sound effects and Music also stop, you play one match in Mypark with the Music, all sound effects and the next match you only have the sound effects of Park itself, like the Bird and Sea sounds on the Park or the Steel mill sounds on the Rough Riders Park but you won't hear the players, the ball or anything else.
Now of course one could argue that sound is just one thing but there are many other problems
- Invisible players, that happens everywhere be it the park or an offline game, sometimes player get invisible but they still play, making points and everything
- You get fouled out (6 fouls) but you can still play
- Players shoot at the wrong hoop (happens with the AI)
- AI players don't know how to behave and resemble more a bunch of scared chickens
There are more issues all around, i have a screenshot of the Store where rings are displayed as pants, that's not fixed one month later.
- Random crashes, unable to invite friends, connection problems, disconnections in the MyPark, connection errors (including crash to desktop) on MyCourt when you invite friends do exist. 2K's servers are notoriously bad and have been bad for the past few years over console generations and now on the PC. It's baffling they don't fix their crap which leads me to the next point:
- Microtransactions. With 2K15 2K introduced  VC to the game, you earn VC by playing matches, be it online, mycareer, mypark or whatever which you can invest in shoes, jerseys, shorts or use on the MyTeam mode as with always, microtransactions on a game that costs 50€ (at least, the MJ edition was 69,99€) is questionable, while you can earn them, you can buy them with real money and 2K this year made sure you can't get enough VC without paying for them. MyTeam has Card Packs that cost 7.500 VC, there are shoes up to 15.000 VC, Jerseys up to 5.000 VC and regardless if you unlock shoe contracts or not, the shoes you design yourself in the main menu outside the career cost you 7.500 VC, regardles of a shoe contract and if you want to proudly display the jersey of your team you play in career in the online park you need to get to a certain park reputation and on top of it, the jersey is another 5.000 VC. Last year those Team Jerseys in the Park were free, now even for that 2K wants your money.

The positive things, are the new things: Team relocation in MyGM and MyLeague are fun and in MyTeam you can use the same features about getting your own Logo (better make sure to not use any trademarked stuff becuase apparently even using and old Team logo that is not available can get you banned and the game only supplies you with the regular 30 NBA Team Logos, despite having classic logos and jerseys available in MyTeam but you're not allowed to use them in MyGM/MyLeague, so you can upload them yourself but you risk getting banned because it is actually a breach of their TOS)
Speaking of MyTeam, it's a grind through hundreds of the same cards and the same old challenges, in fact, it was a lot more fun last year where you could chose between Current and Classic Team Packs, now you only have 3 current packs and at the moment a Rookie Card Pack that can net you anything from a rookie to a silver to an amethyst card pack but most of the time you get the same guys over and over, i got 3 times the same blake griffin rookie of the year card. It's like the game is trolling you and just wants you to waste your MT Points or VC on crap.

Talking about that i want to mention more bugs people had:
- No Keyboard support, while i think playing a sports game on Keyboard (i haven't done that since FIFA 96 personally) is kinda dumb, i think a PC game should support the Keyboard. NBA 2K16 doesn't really, you can't configure keys and the pre-made layout is apparently made for aliens with 3 arms and several more fingers
- In MyCareer you might receive MyTeam Cards through connections...at least that's the theory. I unlocked a few, never got the cards
- Same with the rival day on MyPark, the second week me and some friends helped the Sunset Beach securing a victory and despite constant Claim your reward on the kiosk" messages

we never got the promised VC and reduction of Boosts.

reviewText:
Before I go into the gameplay, let's address the elephant in the room. Spike Lee's My Career. I have a big problem with being forced to be black for the story to make sense. Not because there's anything bad about being black (full disclosure: I'm a black man), but because its lazy writing. Spike seems to want to tell his story of a struggling black kid from Harlem, New York making it to the NBA. That's great for a movie, but this is supposed to be a game. And the best games give the player the most choices. Choices are why Western RPGs like Dragon Age:Inquisition & Skyrim are more popular right now than Japanese RPGs that force you to play through a bunch of set pieces as their stock protagonist. I'm opposed to any game mode that removes choice from players, especially when those choices existed in last year's game.

With that out of the way, NBA 2K16's gameplay has improved over the past two iterations. Defense is more effective & physical. You can't just bully your way into the post with a random SF anymore. Shot selection seems to be even more important this year & fastbreaks actually seem fast this year. The 2K Shop, however, is another matter. They're selling virtual Gatorade now?!? C'mon man...that's just a blatant cash grab. Everything costs VC this year. Designing your court would be great if they didn't nickel & dime you to death for accessories. I know that you can earn some things through My Career, but its still ridiculous to charge 500 VC for different colored nets.

Overall, I enjoy the gameplay more than ever. But 2K needs to stop letting outsiders write stories for games & be a bit less greedy next year. Pick this up now if you're absolutely addicted to sports games. Otherwise, catch it on the next Steam sale.

reviewText:
Much was made about the Spike Lee directed Career/Story Mode but I found it really lacking and hugely disappointing. The biggest problem I have with this was the absolute heavy-ham-handed scripting which instead of adding to immersion actually kills it completely.

Firstly, My Career has always been about creating a player that is you (or that you want) regardless of race. Spike Lee pigeon-holes and shoe-horns you into poor black kid growing up in the projects in Harlem. Cliched much?

My Career tries to present two of the fundamental choices/problems that blue-chip college/young NBA players have: such as whether or not to go one-and-done; whether or not to stick with your homie who's had your back forever but is a bad influence or to ditch him for the good of your career.

So much is made about these problems and how hard it is to choose. Your character literally agonizes over each choice. Then the game/story goes ahead and makes the choices for you. Well duh ... if you're going to belabour the point and make it such a big deal, and if it really is MY career, then I would like to have a say in it, wouldn't you? I honestly only started enjoying the game a bit more after the script ended.

Also another pet peeve is the big deal they make of your created player: high school phenom, blue-chip prospect, once in a generation talent, etc, etc. And you come into the draft with a skill level of 55? This may not be a big deal (and actually fit with the last edition where your player went undrafted) but the disparity is so immersion-breaking. From having 'boosted' stats in High School/College where your 7 foot centre can literally hit 3-pointers from everywhere to missing 2 feet lay-ups in the NBA ... i should think that if I'm actually good enough to be drafted top-20 in the NBA draft i should be at least be able to make a jump-shot or two.

Also, because of whatever reason, your rookie season is abridged into eight games so that Spike Lee can turn your rookie career into a blurb. Which means you only play 8 games (i.e. compared to the regular season 82 you would have played in previous editions - meaning you literally miss out one entire year of skill points and never have a chance to break into the starting line-up). It also means the whole Rookie of the Year target which most players set their sights on is pretty much impossible/redundent.

Game-wise its generally more of the same with better animations. A more robust blocking/swatting system is much welcome. But generally the AI appears to be more tepid and less intelligent this edition. The point-guard hogs the ball way too much and makes really bad decisions/shots. The transition game appears better and fast breaks are a lot more viable but the PC-controlled teams appear to have a huge edge in the transition game (most of the time your team are not even back in their half-court set when the other team pushes the ball back up the court for an empty lane).

tldr: Spike Lee's story kills the immersion and the real game/fun only starts when it ends. They should have made the story-mode a toggle on/off feature when starting a new career. I feel that 2k15 plays a little better and is more immersive.

reviewText:
This review is mainly slated towards MyCareer.

It's really upsetting, I played a lot of NBA 2K15 and after spending a majority of time finishing MyCareer and MyGM/MyLeague, I definitely got my money's worth after 300+ hrs. NBA 2K16, however, got pretty overhyped when regards to their MyCareer, which seemingly got worse.

I think most people were under the impression that after all the positive feedback 2K14 and 2k15 got in regards to MyCareer, and how they enjoy a story around your character, 2k would finally go all out with one this year by hiring Spike Lee to direct it.

Somehow, they went backwards. Even though 2k never had a white voice actor, hiring Spike Lee to be a ghetto visionary and make your family black and growing up in Harlem sort of ruins any illusion that most of the white players could relate to, which btw, alot of your audience is.

As for the customization people were hoping for, it some how becomes even more linear with Spike Lee making a strict storyline with choices you can not choose. Literally, the only choices you can make in MyCareer is Choosing a High School (1 of 3), choosing a college (1 of 9), and at the end of 8 games played (of 82) you get to become a free agent. Meaning if you wanted to play the 2015-2016 league, you only are playing 8 games against the legitimate rosters, and then enter free agency.

How did this happen? Outside of actual games, MyCareer lasted a total of maybe an hour. After completeing college and moving into the draft, Im finally in the NBA, next to top draft picks that have overalls of 78 and 77, meanwhile I have 55 overall and am somehow considered a top 10 pick. Where's summer league? Training camp? Where is anything that can allow me to actually progress without having to spend VC on attributes ?

Most people do NOT want to start the NBA with 55 overall and don't want to have to spend money on VC to stay competitive.

As for what they did right, High School and College felt legitimately realistic. You're a high school phenom, and as such your character is seriously OP. You can steal and run the ball and shoot better than everyone, and as you progress towards the NBA, games get harder in college. Unfortunately there was no real culture to talk about with colleges, the only differences is the uniform and logo, and High School + College combined are over very quickly.

Edit: More time put into MyCareer and gameplay is still solid, and now that the mediocre story is over, the grind for getting badges and practicing in the gym is actually enjoyable. Connections would be more interesting if they were more indepth and you weren't able to exploit them, but overall a nice addition. Still disappointing overall.

Another annoying thing to point out is the fact that during creating MyPlayer, while height and wingspan actually matter in this version of 2k ( which is a good thing ), the fact that choosing inside/outside/balanced position when creating your character limits your possibility as a player, and can't be changed. As a balanced 6'6 SF with maxed shooting, my 3 pt is below average that of another SF in the league.

reviewText:
Been playing NBA2k games since 2k12 and I've noticed this year is pretty ridiculous. I generally play MyCareer as it is the most popular game mode, but I do occassionally play the others.

Pros:
- The game looks great visually
- Easy to adapt to new controls
- Harder to do certain things that wasn't exactly basketball-like that older games had
- Overall very smooth with decent cpu

Cons:
- MyCareer is a racist joke: I ain't black so why is my twin sister black. Stereotypes everywhere. Spike Lee was the worst part about this game.
- Not new user friendly: Be ready to throw your wallet to get any sort of decent start because your mycareer starts with a sub60 rating.
- HOF Cpu is cheese itself: Wide-open jumpers fall 98% of the time. More shocked when it misses.
- Some players just don't make sense: Bench players in real NBA and with low ratings in game plays like Kobe shooting over three guys.
- AI defense is horrible: 80+ rating 3pt rating guard that can't finish on the outside? AI leaves him open. Pick and roll switch up? Non-existent. Basic man-to-man? How about Otto Porter Shaqtin a Fool every game. 30 RPG as a team and your player point guard has 8 of them? Why not.
- Moving like you're on ice: Your player slides and glides like he's on ice and occassionally gets stuck when defending. Absolutely ridiculous.
- AI passing: Have fun with turnovers because your AI teammates can't do jack.
- MyCareer is a joke: Spike Lee is the worst part about this game. Oh wait... I said this already.
- Certain players are just overpowered: Stephen Curry is a prime example.
- Certain players just don't match with their stats and tendencies: Lebron is like the easiest thing to guard and Jeremy Lamb shoots over anybody and everybody. James Johnson shoots threes with a crap rating and low tendency which essentially means a turnover if he catches the ball near the three.
- Refs are walking picks: I run into the ref on the fast break cuz they just on the court. I called for a pass and that thing ain't stopping until it gets to China.
- Player does its own thing: Getting stuck in animations, not being able to do anything in certain situations (dive for ball and catching it, spin move and it starts pole dancing), and hyping up the crowd when opposing guard goes coast to coast for a dunk.
- Get rid of the coach: He's annoying. How you gonna tell me score more inside when the only baskets we get are dunks.
- WTF timeouts: They don't make sense *PERIOD* You get subbed in and a timeout comes immediately after they score. 10/10 trash programming.
- Bounce passes: Slow, clunky, and receiver thinks its a booger and runs from it. No more fancy passes guys, stick with pick-n-roll and hope they don't do some superhuman sh** and intercept it outta nowhere.
- Opposing HoF Defense is hax: Melo jumped over 8ft into the air to swat an alley-oop pass. Checked it in replay and Anthony Davis's head was under his feet. I broke up laughing at how sh** this game was when that happened. Wasn't even mad. Oh yeah and every player has whips as arms since they block passes out of their range.

While a lot of these cons are persistent problems in the 2k games, it's just getting worse. Hyping up the MyCareer didn't help; it just added a sh** ton of backlashes.

reviewText:
Having pre-ordered NBA 2K16 (following the hype train, woot-woot!), I got the opportunity to play already, and I was able to quickly form an opinion on the in my eyes most important mode of the game, the MyCareer mode. I’m one of those who basically bought the game for this mode alone, where you take control of a new player in the NBA and lead him to greatness.

By now, I’ve played three quarters of my rookie season, after leading my player through high school and first year of college. I’m blown away by how much of a blowout this game is. “Hold it right there for a second,” you might say, “the game isn’t out long enough for you to have played so far ahead!” If I didn’t know better, I would agree with you on that. The problem is, however, your “rookie season” is 8 (eight!) games long.

Yes, you’ve read right. I was shocked when I got to the “gym menu” and read that it was the first of eight games I would get to play in my rookie season. It’s frustrating. The game doesn’t give you any option to change this. This is not a basketball simulation anymore, it’s a farce.

I want to lead my player through all 82 games of a season (plus even more in post-season, if possible), and in full-length at that. Maybe I don’t get much further than my rookie season until the next game comes out, but I’m with my player all the way until then. When the commentators praise my last game, I want to have been there for that. Why should I give a damn about what the AI made my player do?

I don’t get any credits for that to spend on my abilities, I don’t get any chance to rise to starhood early on, and I don’t get any sort of information how I’m doing outside of the commentary for the next game I’m playing, or at least I haven’t found it in the cryptic menu structure.

“Featuring a Spike Lee joint” is the worst thing they could’ve done. You’re forced to suffer through one of the most annoying stories I’ve ever played. And I’ve been through all of “Dying Light”. They praise it in the trailers with “Be The Story”. Guess what, that’s all you get to do, because you can’t make one on your own.

I didn’t know what to expect, so my player is pretty much me. Every NBA 2K game I’ve played before gave me the opportunity to “be myself”, which mostly meant, a white guy with a similar name (so the commentators don’t just call me by my nickname) and “College” Germany (and a different height, depending on the position). In 2K16, that means a 7ft tall (Center) white guy has a black twin sister that seems at least a foot smaller, has no similarities in their looks whatsoever, and stays bland throughout the story, a problem all characters have in this. You don’t get to choose anything about yourself beside the appearance and some on-court details. Everything but the teams you play for is pretty much set in stone; and the teams you play for do not change the story a bit.

You follow a story of some random dude, instead of forming him yourself. There are some major crossroads he just barrels through without you being consulted. But hey, you can choose to go to UCLA instead of UConn. Congratulations.

Even when you think you can choose something important (what a heated discussion in a cut scene about staying another year in College or agreeing to enter the Draft builds up to), he just says, “here’s what I’m going to do…”, cut to black screen, and whoop-de-do, welcome to the NBA Draft 2016!

I feel no connection to Harlem. I feel no connection to the family. Suddenly I have a girlfriend, and I have no idea why she’s here (when I first saw her, I was like “Hey, who’s that? Oh, she looks nice, and she’s in an important meeting… she might be my girlfriend. Oh her name’s Yvette? Cool.”). My so-called best friend is always up to no good and I spend six-figure sums in lawyers and settlements to keep everything quiet about him and his escapades. My agent (who I obviously don’t get to choose, either) is a New Yorker, a self-proclaimed “Shark” with italian roots, where every “Mobster cliche” bell in my head starts ringing like a shot clock. I have no say in this at all.

The story tries very hard to create drama (to the point where it’s hard for me to suspend my disbelief), but it fails miserably at making me care, because it lacks decisions where my actions would have any sort of impactful consequences. If this was a movie, I wouldn’t see it in theatres, I wouldn’t rent it, and wouldn’t even waste my time on it would it be on Netflix.

Technically, the game is up to snuff concerning the simulation part, even though I despise getting fouled out in the third quarter because of the mechanics for setting picks (and for calling illegal screens). Otherwise, it’s ridiculously bad. The menu structure is horrible, you don’t find anything quickly. A training option where you get to train the moves one by one is completely missing, instead you get four instructional videos with instructions read by NBA stars who can muster about as much enthusiasm as if they were reading a recipe for sour cream cheesecake - or dubbing a 70s sex ed video.

In the few hours I’ve played, I’ve had about half a dozen Back-To-Desktop crashes, without the game freezing (it just closed the window). Other than that, the servers aren’t the most reliable, but that might be because the game isn’t even officially released yet. Oh god, I dread what it will be like in the week following the official release...

Graphically, it looks very good, but that’s to be expected. There isn’t much more to improve graphically, anyway. Last year’s NBA 2K looked great, too. My PC isn’t the best out there, but it manages to give a decent image.

UPDATE: As one of the comments so helpfully pointed out, the game reverses back to normal" in the second season. The so-called "story" only ruins your rookie year

reviewText:
After so 27 hours of playing, i can definitely say, 2K games screwed up pretty badly..

Story, gameplay, optimization, VC... This is not my first NBA game. I've been playing NBA games since 98 and this year i got very excited about 2K16, but it really ruined every expactation of mine.

First of all My Career. Are you serious? Spike Lee did this? I mean i don't have a high opinion about Spike Lee but this much?! Let me tell you guys, You are gonna watch series of cutscenes till you get into NBA. These cutscenes feel very very dull after watching some of them. and story is one person's dream. Not Livin' Da Dreeeaaammm. It's Spike Lee's Dreeeaamm... Damn..... So called Livin' Da Dream (My Career) is this. Cutscenes... Cutscenes.. Cutscenes...

Optimization. I won't even write about it. If any official from 2K reading this, this is not acceptable.

Pre-order bonuses. Unacceptable.

I will definitely not buy 2K17 until i see reviews and youtube videos next year.

reviewText:
I (actual me) play as an average size/weight forward-center in Australia. I used NBA2K10 previously, and found that after playing it I was more conscious of my court position and defense in real games. Shocked! Playing from third person perspective made me focus on things that I hadn't really nailed on the real courts. I actually spent a whole season playing 2K10 for a couple hours before every game.

Overall, I think a guy like me is in a pretty excellent position to judge the gameplay here, so I think I owe it to everyone to review it.

I made myself in the game - Average size center. 7'0, 260. Though real me takes few jumpers I opted for all-around.

So far, the good stuff;

I love the post movement! It really echoes the way a lot of new players are being taught to post - not thinking about individual moves but thinking about position and response - You make a move and shoot if your defender wasn't able to respond, step through if he responded too hard, and make a second move if he responds smartly. It's very fluid, it's exactly how I think about my real post movement, and I like it.

The second season (Takes a long time to get there...) is much, much better than the ruined first season. You have choice about your actions. You are coached... (it's rudimentary but at least it makes you think about changing your game up). You get to train (awesome!), doing some drills that might look familiar to organized ballers, and there is plenty of variation so you don't just do the same drill every time.


So far, the bad stuff;

The main reason I'm not recommending this: It's freezing. Sometimes it locks my computer completely, sometimes it merely quits the program mid-game. The first few hours this wasn't an issue. Today it seemed to be happening every game or two. I really don't have time to screw around with this kind of issue, and I'm sure a lot of you don't either.

Skipping training is a smart thing to do in season 2? Plain stupid. Since you literally buy your skill, practice is now just a waste of valuable marketing time. I actually liked the training drills - especially as a guy who is new to playing virtual-basketball and using a game pad.

In shootaround at training, you can't go back-to-basket and do a post move. What? I guess my guy is afraid of getting hit in the back of the head by a bricked shot. ♥♥♥♥♥. Let me post like in the home court screen. It matters to me, I'm a F/C. I don't want to shoot 3-pointers.

Slow players jump unreasonably high. Head crashing into the backboard but I can't change direction. In real players, vertical leap is pretty closely related to the general speed of the player on his feet. Very noticeable in 55OVR F/Cs.

Starter F/Cs react so slowly that there's no way they could ever play NBA. The slow CPU centers easily bust past 2 step sags.

Guards tend to misuse my screens - use me to shear off the defender! They are afraid of brushing my shoulder.
To make up for this, 2k have put in some STUPID AI/animations where the screened opponent will go out of his way to trip over you. I've had a guy constantly changing direction just to trip over me while his man is 40 feet away making a layup. Insane stuff - it feels like cheating. I've counted guys running into me 4 or more times, long after their player has made his move. Sometimes they run into me even though their man is cutting away from me. They WANT to hit the screen.

I have my stats elevated by crazy bursts of speed when I go for blocks and rebounds from way out.

There's no context to the actions - player never seems to bail out of a rebound when he should.
Forwards aren't ready for rebounds. They seem to set feet after you tell them to rebound, not when the shot goes.

At least one 3-sec violation per game because he refuses to move after ignored call for pass. UNFORGIVABLE.

The lack of depth perception (Not 2k's fault, but still a problem) means it's impossible to judge where a lot of shots will fall, limiting your ability to be ready for rebounds. CPU always gets the rebound on short airballs. Always.


I'd say center is unplayable at 55ovr, but it gets a lot better once you up your stats a few points across everything. Pretty irritated about the amount of time it took for it to be playable though - I shouldn't need 10 hours of gameplay to be able to change direction and make a freethrow. Put me on an even footing. I don't want to dominate, I just want to be in the game. I am not able to believe I wouldn't get benched after 20 minutes shooting 20%, with a plus/minus of -15.

As for the rest - you heard it in every other review. The first season is completely ruined. You aren't actually in any control until the 2nd season, so I guess it's NBA2k17. What were they thinking? The game runs as badly as my player does. Tutorials are garbage. A white guy will have a black twin... Everything bad anyone else says is probably true.

Oh - and it's pretty hilarious to have my own shoe after half a season making 8ppg coming off the bench. 10/10 for comedy value. (And it's ♥♥♥-ugly. Didn't previous versions let you design them?)

reviewText:
My honest thoughts about NBA2K16 and the NBA2K franchise:

NBA2K16's gameplay is great. The overall presentation is very smooth and the graphics have really stepped up its game since 2K15. I don't think the controls are as great as it was in 2K15, but I don't really have any complaint about it. No more ripped jersey shorts when players are dunking. No more of those alien-esque eye contacts when camera pans in on the players' faces. Also a lot less shot-clock cheese.

MyCareer this year has given me the most emotional turmoil, ever. I really disliked the story, as you probably have heard everywhere how Spike Lee tried to add in his 2 cents to 2K, which resulted in the your player's family being African American regardless of what color skin your player has. I do enjoy the many accolades your player is able to achieve and how quickly you are able to level your character up to at least an all-star level. One of the things I hated about the previous NBA2K MyCareers is how little of VC earnings you get after every game, but 2K has fixed that issue in this year's release.

MyTeam is a mode I enjoy very much. Every week 2K releases packs that you are able to buy and every week it has a different series of challenges that you are able to compete. 2K has really increased the amount of variety of player cards that you are able to receive. For example, for every NBA player there are multiple player cards such as the player's default card, dynamic ratings card, moments card, playoffs card, TBT player card, all star card, MVP card, and many more. Each card by the same player has different ratings depends on the type of cards, and it really adds in some flavor in collecting your cards and makes it exciting to open up packs because it always catch you off guard on what cards you may get. My personal favorite: a bronze Sim Bhullar rated at 69, but is an absolute beast in the post both offensive and defensively in the game.

MyPark in my opinion is... ehhh. The gameplay is really great and all, but a lot of the times the park is either empty or is just a bunch of people who have formed cliques, or squads, to play against each other. If you are just trying to play a game by yourself, good luck finding a match because you can't sit wid us".

Now

reviewText:
I do recommend this game for any basketball fan out there, but NBA 2K16 has its pros and cons. I'll break it down.

Pros:
-Smoother Animations
-Dunk Animations are a lot better
-Improved MyCareer
-Defense movement has been improved
-Rebounding has also improved (Thank God)
-Stunning Graphics
-Shoe Deals are now gone so now you don't need to wait like 30 games+ for a shoe deal (Thank you lord)

Cons:
-Frame Rate Issues (Usual with early release games due to NVIDIA Drivers or 2K Sports optimizations not done correctly)
-Where are the bonus's from the Pre-Orders?
-Animations seem to stutter once in a while
-Without the shoe deal, it requires you to purchase them with in game VC (Although this is a lot better than waiting 30 games+ for a shoe deal)
-Default graphics processor is Intel's Integrated GPU (WTF?)


With all that said,
NBA 2K16 isn't a bad game and it's definiately a better basketball simulator than NBA Live series that EA is trying to bring back. It just requires new NVIDIA Drivers or 2K Sports to optimize the game. Gameplay and all is fine. Just the lag is just killing me.

MY CAREER ONLY REVIEW ONLY

Pros:

Unfortuately there is the other 40% and makes you want to throw your remote through the monitor.  There is nothing worse than playing a game and feeling like you have no outcome on the results.  Hmm...come to think of it...sounds just like Spike Lee's garbage.  OOPS!  Sorry...that was a rip in the PROS section.  Sorry!

CONS:

--I don't think I have to elaborate much on the utter BS that is Spike Lee.  He makes the first part of the game so painful that I am DREADING having to do it again.  I know you can skip things but you should not have to live through one second of it.  As other says....it's brutal.  What's funny is that if a white person had done this 'first year' he would have been called a racist.  Since it's Spike its ok evidently.  Add to it that you have ZERO control on ANYTHING that happens.....just f-ing brutal.   A cut scene where the parents talk about how they met?  Are you MENTAL?  OMG!!!! Who the SH-T gives a flying f-ck how his parents met?  Seriously?  If I wanted to read that I would steal my wife's romance novels.  STOP THE MADNESS!

---The game is 'fixed' to an extent, worse so on the higher difficulties.  If you shoot 65% from the field the Ai will simply 'adjust' the game so that the other team will get multiple offensive rebounds (even if they are the worst rebounding team in the league), have 10+ points more from the free throw line (in one quarter) and of course the old faithful game 'balancer the 3 point shot.  Listen
date: this happens every F-ing game!!!!!  Its not a 'every once in a while' thing...the computer WILL make you miss/turn the ball over/<insert thing you did not do>.\n\n--As you play you will be "throttled".  In this I mean that in 'real life' the chances of you going 10 for 10 from the field is pretty slim.  Well

this is just a game of code so you WILL be forced to miss shots.  I am ok with missing shots...its just missing the WIDE OPEN LAYUP or DUNK....TWICE IN A ROW....that I can not tolerate.  If you are not throttled there it will happen at the beginning of the game (especially in game 2 or 3 of a playoff series).  You will 'magically' start only making 1 or 2 out of 7 shots.  That happens right? The problem is your shots are of the wide open layup/dunk variety.  I just roll my eyes becuase I KNOW that I will 'struggle with my shot'...and then magically make the next 12!  This exact situation has happened MANY times to the point that I can predict it after 3 shots in the game.

--I duped a guy in the post.  I went up for a layup (not sure why a 7'3" guy would do a layup when he can DUNK while standing on the floor) and just...missed it.  Can't this happen?  SURE it has happened.  The problem is that it happens EVERY F-ING GAME!  This is 10 fold the story when you play the highest difficulty.  I passed to a streaking Jimmy Butler who was a few feet ahead of his guy...aka a BREAKAWAY.  He could have dunked it with his mouth if he wanted...but he does a layup and almost missed the whole rim.  Why?  We were past the magical number the computer said we could be ahead because it must REMAIN CLOSE!

reviewText:
This game is mediocre at best. Rebounding works good, thats the only praise I will give this game. Story sucks, character creation sucks, customization sucks, pay too win sucks, gameplay sucks and can be incredibly frustrating to the point of wanting to punch a hole through your monitor or smash your game pad into a thousand little pieces.  Honestly, this game just sucks.

Below is what is broken.

-CPU STEALS (Good luck dribbling in a straight line, the cheese cpu steals are real with this one, guess how many times cpu gets called for reaching in? NEVER)

- ISO MOVES ( Also ties into the cpu cheese steals, I call it the turnover stick now. Even with the absolute setting and a decent playmaking skill half the time you will do a random move and often multiple random moves which results in, you guessed it, turnovers)

- SHOT METER ( So you know for a fact you got a perfect release? Well 2k doesnt think so. So many times I've stoped the slider on the left of the bar only for it to magically appear on the right)

- USER STEALS ( So youre hand goes straight through the ball and you think you've got yourself a steal? Think again, the cpu steal cheese does not carry over to your abilities, you're more likely to get called for a reach in. Many times the cpu will run right through you and it wont even phase him, you try to do the same? TURNOVER)

- CPU DEFENSE ( So you just pulled off a sick spin move without turning the ball over and you're now 6ft away from your opponent with an open lane to the rim? Well too bad! The cpu wizardry will warp the player at light speed and stop you in your tracks mid dribble)

- USER DEFENSE ( Good luck playing any sort of relevant defense as a guard if you dont have near max athleticism, you could play defense just as good as the computer but the cpu will most of the time either glitch right through you or run right around you with ease, and good luck getting back on defense if you take one wrong step because youll be stuck there for about 3 seconds)

-CPU SHOT SELECTION ( So you just tossed Joakim Noah the ball right on the baseline with an easy driving lane to the hoop and you're wondering what kind of mystical dunk he is getting ready to perform? FORGET ABOUT IT, he's going to stay planted and shoot a fadeaway 12 footer and miss badly, costing you an assist and some points on the board.

- TURBO BUTTON ( So you're mashing the turbo button because you see something in the defense you can exploit? Well too bad for you because it will take at least 2 seconds, if at all, before your character decides to start sprinting into a cpu player who wasn't there 2 seconds ago which results in more turnovers.



I know I'm forgetting many more flaws.

PLEASE, WHATEVER YOU DO, DO NOT BUY THIS GAME. DO NOT SUPPORT THE DEVELOPER WHEN THEY CONTINUE TO RELEASE BAD GAME MECHANICS YEAR AFTER YEAR AND DO NOT RELEASE ANY SORT OF RELEVANT PATCHES. STICK WITH 2K15 OR 2K14 FOR THAT MATTER, AS EVEN THOSE GAMES ARE SLIGHTLY BETTER THAN THIS TRASH. DO NOT BE A SUCKER AND WASTE 60$ ON THIS GAME, YOU WILL BE DISAPPOINTED. DONT EXPECT TO PLAY ONLINE UNLESS ALL OF YOUR FRIENDS PLAY BECAUSE THIS GAME IS DEAD, MY PARK IS EMPTY. ONLY GET THIS GAME IF YOU WANT TO AVERAGE 8 TURNOVERS A GAME WITH YOUR MY PLAYER POINT GUARD.

IF YOU TAKE ANYTHING FROM THIS REVIEW IT SHOULD BE DONT BUY THIS GAME!!!

reviewText:
A review from the most despised guy on the 2k16 forum right now coming live and free of charge (no VC here) right to you:

It's hard to actually find somewhere to start guys and gals because there is just so much wrong with this game. Maybe let's do it bit by bit:

General:

- good ol' VC is returning and damn it's good to have it back. I so missed flushing 50 bucks down the toilet for a game and then being charged for any and every ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t item. The prices have gone up and are now really insane while how much you earn, even on HoF has actually gone down.

- lack of technical support makes a return as well. Yeah like always the PC community is again the but of the joke because again we are desperately waiting for technical issues to be solved and are waiting and waiting and waiting. 4 weeks after the pre-release the PS4 patch is out for 2 weeks now and we still haven't seen ♥♥♥♥ or even been given a possible release date.

- lack of support also makes a comeback. Yeah for a game that costs you 50 bucks or more you will actually have to wait  up to seven days to even get a random answer which does not relate to your problem at all and which, even when you press them, offers no help whatsoever because they either don't know or they aren't allowed to do anything.

- commentary of the game cuts out like every quarter. It's unbearable.

- there is a bug that displays players naked or makes the invisible. They are invisible yet they pass, dribble, shoot and score on your ♥♥♥ all day long.

- 2k TV regulary crashes the game.

- the audience is barely audible. During freethrows and timeouts it's basically like you are playing a pickup team on a farm in Iowa... no sound at all.

- you have around 10-20 seconds before the actual timeout screen sets in allowing you to change settings and setups and you can not ever skip those 10-20 seconds. So have fun with that one especially when the stupid A.I. calls 2 timesouts back to back.

- basically anything above Allstar Sim is getting close to unplayable because of all the incredible cheese the A.I. pulls off

- defensive A.I. of opponent improved while the defensive A.I. of your team is absolute garbage in every situation

- still too many animations in which your player gets sucked into

MyCareer:

reviewText:
Overall the gameplay is much improved from NBA 2k15(which i put almost 600 hours into) between MYGM, and MyCareer modes. There are more animations and they feel smoother and more realistic. Dribbling and using the right stick to crossover and perform other moves is still very satisfying. The shot meter is back and feels the same helping you to guide shots into the net. Defense even has its own meter that shows how close to the defender you are and how much pressure you are producing on him.  There have been some small control changes since 2k15. Now the face buttons of the controller allow you to perform bounce passes, or lob passes alongside the standard pass. This helps you feel more in control and turn the ball over less. Centers and other big men down low feel more like you are playing their counter parts. Slow, not very good ball handling but big tall bruisers who use their size to their advantage. Defense has been slightly improved and shots are harder to make, as you are less likely to be wide open. This more realistically portrays FG % in the NBA and feels less cheesy online.

Graphics are improved as well, with 2k adding in new body scans. Carmelo Anthony now looks substantially different than Lebron James. As mentioned before animations feel smoother and more realistic. I have experienced some crashing issues when in game and navigating menues. There are also some random glitches in game that detract from the overall experience. For example there is a new feature when your my player is subbed into the game.This feature shows the player you are currently guarding or being guarded by. It shows the players strengths and weaknesses. There is a problem that occurs randomly however when the players strengths/ weaknesses never appear and you are stuck looking at a semi frozen image of the player for 30 seconds. After playing last years version im sure the bugs will still be there months later(none are gamebreaking save for the infrequent crashes, just minor annoyances.)

There is no ability to configure keyboard controls. 2k literally gave no thought to the PC gamer with this port. Crossfire is terrible but with my one AMD r9 270x i am getting 60 FPS with very little stuttering, so i am pleased with the optimization especially over last years version.

There is a wide plethora of game modes in this years game, i have never dabbled in My team because i hate pay to win. But MYGM is fun and feels improved. The real reason i cannot recommend this game at full price is the changes to MYCareer and to be specific the changes directed by Spike Lee. Livin' Da Dream is a joke.You create a character like in past iterations of the gamemode however this time you dont get to choose a nickname because that persona has already been created for you. Spike Lee has dubbed your character Frequency Vibrations or Freq for short, sex toy or porn star either way the name is terrible. The story revolves around your character and his family, you are born into a african-american family with an african-american twin sister. If the story following all this was actually good and well written than maybe i could excuse my white character who looked totally out of place and confused as to why his mom had never told him who his real father was. Honestly its not a big deal, things like this have happened to other races and games in the past and i could get over it, the problem is the story is absolutely terrible. The story revolves around your friend VIctor Van Lier who is supossed to be a bad influence on you and you are warned multiple times by the team owner, your twin sister, and your characters girlfriend who comes out of nowhere sometime in college.

You dont get to make any choices about how your story unfolds besides the choice of High schools (1 of 3) and choice of colleges (1 of 9). The story is so melodramatic, people arguing over your image or multiple refrences to friends and family using you as a meal ticket. Choices of team do not affect the story any. Minor details like your characters celebratory dance freaking and vibin" as well as interviews of family and friends during the cutscenes do nothing to add anything to the terribly written farse that is Livin' Da Dream.  Spike Lee seems to believe that people from Harlem have the same terrible vernacular that he embodys in his titles. This terrible story mode takes away your rookie season as well
date: which is something that 2k really seems to enjoy in MYCareer the last two years. You get to play 3 Highschool games where your character is truly OP and 4 college games but not earn any VC for them as well as not be able to change the game lengths. Your character than is forced to be a one and done player and go to the NBA draft with an overall rating of 55
recommended: which is terrible. You are heralded as a top 10 draft pick
hoursPlayed:
i went number 7 but the other players selected around that time are 77-78. By design 2k makes you either a terrible player or have to open your wallet just to keep up. Your rookie season is only 8 games (instead of the 82 in a real NBA season) with Spike Lee's terrible 20 minute cutscenes in between. Also you can change the Freq nickname after your rookie season but for some reason announcers/ pre game show will still sometimes refer to you as Freq.

After your rookie season MyCareer returns to its roots allowing you to play any games along the season you would like while also introducing a new days off feature and allowing you to select whether or not to go to a "Live practice" or hang out with teamates/fellow Nba players or go do endorsement deals. This is where MyCareer should have started. "Live Practices are fun and really the draw in this mode is building a character and watching his career progress rather than slated cutscenes of melodrama.

Somewhere along the way this mode lost all its basing in realisim as well because after your first season the team owner realeases you to go into Free Agency where you can choose three teams that have varying levels of interest in your sevices and negotiate Money and minutes. I think Spike Lee tries to rationalize it with your friend Victor causing you to get fired. Honestly though has anyone ever heard of a top 10 pick being dropped because of a friends actions? Spike Lee just took the easy way out as he did with most of the other parts of this mode.


Tldr: Really i cant recommend the game even though gameplay is so much better and graphics improved because of how much the Mycarrer mode has declined. I still find ways to enjoy the game

reviewText:
2K abuses their dominance if not their de-facto monopoly on basketball gaming, as they would never dare with their other devs such as Firaxis (civ):       Microtransactions on a fully priced game, intentionally affects pacing: While on the first MyPlayer you make on 2k16/2k15 you will tolerate it, somewhat, any subsequent player will be a total grind if you don't buy VC

Unskippable cutscenes, or cutscenes that need delay before they can be skipped: entering a timeout, exiting it, half time breaks, news cast at the end of the game, etc.  Either you have to wait before skipping, or you can't skip, a nightmare.

Exploitable animations have only been fixed at the time of this review (mid May 16), just an example of the low update rate of this game

POOR PC support, now NBA 2K always disrespected PC, but this is nuts, delayed patches, less care for PC only bugs, and their history of bringing engines late to PC

These are just a small sample, did I say an abusing monopoly?

reviewText: This is my review of NBA 2k16(aka Skinner Box Simulator 2k16). I think NBA 2k is consistently the only worthwhile basketball title every year.  I love it mostly. But I was unable to even connect to this offerings server. It also follows a sad precedent that appears to be taking hold in the video game industry, especially in the regurgitated yearly sports titles. I named myself B F Skinner and wanted to get online in 2k almost as a ironic statement of protest, but wasn't able to. Back in the days, a guy named BF Skinner put hamsters in a box and studied their reward response through a small lever and a treat that was dropped upon pressing it. He figured out that when they press it and instantly receive said reward, they will eat the treat and lie down. But when the reward was randomly dropped they would continuously press the button to exhaustion.\n\nThis is the basic underlying element of MyTeam. If you don't believe it, watch any of the pack openings on internet video sites. What you are witnessing is the highs and lows which stimulates the brains chemical response mechanisms. When the user taps the button(buying packs) he will repeatedly get cards he doesn't like leading to depression/frustration. When a gold/whatever other stupid color special card drops, they jump all over the place with glee, brains flooding with endorphines. This is troubling if one understands the mechanisms which are involved, considering real money is being spent. Seems to closely resemble the same involvement of drug abusers and their crack of choice. If doubles where eliminated, or if VC was more readily attainable, I guess it would seem more acceptable. It also seems to be marketed directly to minorities, which is another thing that may or may not be okay to you. I have also seen that when one shows a willingness to spend money, your myteam players seem to perform worse then they should. I can recall in 2k15, getting Steph Curry(Mr three ball cheese) and lighting it up with glee. All of a sudden he's hitting 2-30. Same with KD. etc etc. Gotta get more packs

reviewText:
so I play the 2k series since nba2k8.

I say this first before i'll write my review, i keep playing this game most likely.

So i start with the Pro's first
-Great Graphics, awesome faces etc
-mycareer,myleague,mygm and myteam are nice and well done
-it runs very smoothly on my rig


so cons, well where do i start ?
Lets just start with animations, while animations on its own are sick and look awesome, Ingame they are a pain in the ♥♥♥!
You'll get stuck in movements you don't press. while my PG is a 89Rating, he seems to forget sometimes how to dribble(which is weird with playmaking above average). Passing is pretty easy, but sometimes the players are getting into a movement right before you pass, those passes fly anywhere but not to a teammate( it seems to me this happens because the game has overall big problems with input lag). Input lag is annoying af, i tested it now on several configurations and two different rigs, as well 4 different controllers. Its always there and always affecting things on court.
If you're an attacking pg, this game hates you then, while you drive to the basket and have a path like moses, everybody on the opponent team will catch you( not matter how fast you are)i witnessed it a lot that a sf or sg just kinda teleported to me and blocked me, while i was getting stucked in some weird layup animation i did not choose(i have the steph curry layup pack, which rarely applies). Big no go is also defense. Enemy Teams always defend like pros (which is actually nice and challanging)BUT your Team defend like a new born child, this is especially in mycareer annoying. Im sure that withour those animation stucks and rigged scores this game would make actually a lot of fun, ofc the input lag should be fixed(this seems like its pc only, as i watched many youtubers and streamers and they never really had it)

one thing to the mycareer, while i like the idea its poorly made! hey they got spike lee and some actors WoW! the story is boring
and never really interesting, also never really a surpise whats happening( besides the talk that im a superstar when i only play 12 min per game(12min qtr). its way to short as well.

so this game seems to be only for addicted nba dudes like me, new guys wont like it. the controlls are way do difficult. and no help for new guys when they start a career or do something else, they have to search for help(yeah i know tutorials are boring but for new players in this type of a game, needed badly)

my final conclusion is:
if you love the nba and the nba2k series you most probably already have it, if not you may pass on, on this one.
its way better then nba live(which tbh is not very hard)but since they got next gen" it did get more and more a type of game that looks and plays awesome for the first 2 weeks
date:
but if u know more of it and understand everything it starts to fall apart.
i have also a lot more i could go on about but those things are in the series forever so i do not believe they fix it ever.


ps i forgot about mypark:
mypark is kinda fun but on pc their're a lot of cheated players (99ovr) which are mostly pretty bad but a lot of 2v2 groups are out there cheating their ways to the top. Also a lot of ballhogs and wannabe kobes

reviewText: Best basketball sim on the market... but mainly because NBA Live sucks that much. NBA 2k16 gets revised controls, slightly better graphics, and a new story mode. If you've played an NBA 2k game in the past you know what you're getting into. Sadly, this includes a lot of the AI frustrations you come to expect. Instead of playing intelligent AI the way 2k  ramp up difficulty is making you miss dunks, layups and making the computer intercept passes like crazy. Tough to recommend due to the poor AI, but then again what choice do you have as a basketball gamer? Also, who wants to see all those useless inbounding and timeout animations? Everyone is just tapping A like crazy to try and skip it... Also where is the ability to save different GM files? The new story mode has such a long and boring beginning it's hard to get into as well. Maybe I'm just being old and grumpy, but the 2K series is getting too cinematic for its own good. How about 2K focus on making the core basketball gameplay better and get rid of the fluff.

reviewText:
Preface this: Been buying and playing NBA2K since the beginning... And 5 years straight on Steam. I put in hundreds of hours each year. I love NBA2k. But...

...This is the worst one. Ever. That's really all I can say.

I really don't want to go back to NBA Live (hey that was the only option back in the day) but this PC launch is rough. Buggy. The menus werent ported, no proper key binding, a painfully awkward career mode where my bench player is a superstar... The awkward key assignments...

...How do you manage to actually REMOVE menu options from one year to the next?

...And I have to ask... wtf is that intro movie with the cartoon characters? Outsource your intro?

I love NBA2K, but this is sad. I was so pumped at the prospect of playing highschool, college then going pro... but this untested, unoptimized, poorly ported mess is the most dissapointing basketball game I've played in a decade... And that makes me really sad... Patch this 2K. In the meantime I'm going to go checkout your competition because clearly the PC market isn't worth your time.

reviewText:
The MyCareer gets boring at times and its the only game mode that I really like.

It left the immersive side of 2k15:
-no more interviews after the game (at least for your player)
-no more talking with your teammates other than practice with them which is not really that immersive
-the introduction of all-stars is still not enough for you to get hype of (I mean come on its the weekend!)
-I can't see the social media even if you can edit your social ID (you can't view the reactions of your fans)
-the connections are boring (I expected cutscenes but was disappointed)
-the free agency is boring without interaction from your agent
-no more cutscenes from free agency
-the team manager is also non-existing after the first season
-you don't even have the time to visit your family on summer
-no summer camps which is really really important to add immersion for the next season

I mean they added the wishlists from last year such as the jersey pick and such but they removed the other immersive stuffs like WTF? If they just invest their time on expanding the story rather than hiring Spike Lee to do a short and ♥♥♥♥♥♥ movie that would be great.

reviewText:
If you have 2K15, don't buy this at all. Whatever mode you want to play, 2K15 is better.

The gameplay is worse this year, and sticky defense comes back with a vengence. You can't even take 5 steps without the defense bodying you up.

Worse than that, turbo is broken. Players who are slower are catching faster players regardless of attributes, and everyone can defend like Scottie Pippen 1v1, regardless of attributes. Not a fun experience.

MyCareer sucks badly. I got tricked into buying the game because of the so called story, but there isn't one. It's the same  damn thing as 2K15. Essentially your entire rookie season is condensed into a cutscene where you watch stuff happens, stuff that you won't ever do. Also, no more custom nicknames, you're stuck with Freq. Forever.

Online takes the cake, though. Cheaters are rampant, and the people who ends up banned are the ones like me, people who accidentally discover bugs in the game and report them. I got banned for simming games, trying to upgrade my MC.

PC support sucks. XBone and PS4 already got patch 2, and not even a mention of PC.

Don't buy it. Don't even accept it as a gift. If you get it as a gift, trade it in for store credit and go buy a decent game instead. Fallout 4 looks to be decent, grab that.

reviewText:
Every year, basketball games like to brag about how much smoother and more fluid the game is. I think this is the first time it was very clear that a lot of things did improve. This is quite honestly the best basketball video game I have ever played.

I haven't run into many performance issues, and the game runs much smoother for me at even higher settings than 2K15. Your mileage may vary, though. This game was designed with a controller, so I wouldn't recommend playing with a keyboard. The pro stick (RS) is essential to playing this game, and keyboards just won't offer you the same level of control.

Most of the game modes in this year's game are pretty much similar to last year, but with more meat. In MyGM and MyLeague You can now relocate your team if you wish, and your owner can now give more dynamic goals (in GM). Also, AI logic is heavily improved and makes building a perfect team much more challenging, if not impossible. MyLeague also now has an online mode where you can play a League with your friends, similar to The Association Online from a few years back. MyTeam, along with the game modes present in the previous year, also has a new game mode called the Gauntlet, which is a 3 vs. 3 game against other MyTeams.

The game now also has more online features than ever. MyPark makes a return from last year, which is pretty much the same, but now you also have a customizable MyCourt where you can invite your friends to play on. There is also the 2K Pro-Am mode which is similar to the Jordan Rec Center in the previous game, but not hidden behind the MyPark system. It also has a proper matchmaking system, which makes it much easier to get 10 people from around the world to get together to play a full 5-on-5 game. There is also Play Now Online which is basically a ranked online game mode where you can advance through different leagues" which represent your skill level. Pretty similar to most other games' ranked matchmaking modes.

MyCareer is in a weird place
date: where the game actually have already built a whole backstory for your created player. It has some weird quirks as I created a white player living in an African-American town
recommended: with African-American parents and an African-American twin sister. That takes the immersion out of the game mode a little. However
hoursPlayed: it is interesting in the way that you get to experience a custom curated story
voteText: unlike previous years where you're mostly just playing to increase your stats. You also now play through high school and college
helpfulPercent: which makes for an interesting experience
votesHelpful: instead of just being thrown straight into the league.\n\nThe presentation is also much improved. The menu interface is much slicker and more accessible than 2K15. The actual game also now has pre-show
votesTotal: halftime and post-game shows featuring Shaq
votesFunny: Ernie Johnson and Kenny Smith. The voice of the third commentator (replacing Steve Kerr) is awesome. There are also lots of player interviews which helps the atmosphere that you're watching a live TV broadcast. There are 50(!) in-game songs that make up the soundtrack which almost guarantees that you won't get tired of the playlist. Genres range from the standard rap/hip-hop to rock to pop and even some Spanish and one Korean song.\n\nAnd those are all great
commentsCount: but the best feature this game has is really how much better the actual basketball game is. Drives feel much smoother and traffic congestion within the paint is now no longer a problem if you run proper plays.  Defense is also much smoother and as a defender
column16: I haven't found myself being left behind by the ball handler unless I make an actual mental error. The controls have changed
column17: and there are now 3 pass buttons (seriously?)
column18: but the post trigger (LT) is a great idea and if you get used to the new controls
column19: it actually feels more natural than the previous games. And of course
column20: learn how to use the pro stick for best results.\n\nI'm sure if I play more hours of the game
column21: I'll start to notice some annoying quirks. However
column22: 5 hours and counting with the game and I can say that this is the most fun I have with a basketball video game. Even when you're losing
column23: you're still having fun because the game doesn't feel like it's forcing invisible walls for you to get through.\n\nIf you're interested in basketball
column24: and you haven't played a basketball video game in a while
column25: NBA 2K16 is the one to play."

reviewText:
There are mixed reviews for this game, but now that it's on sale (as of Mar 16), I feel obligated to leave a review for those who may be thinking of buying.

Ultimately, if you love the game of basketball, you should get this game right now.

Notes on MyCAREER:
- There are a &#$^ ton of people giving it negative reviews solely because of the subpar MyCAREER story, but if you can look past that it's still a solid basketball game.
- highschool + college years are really fun albeit short
- your MyCAREER players all share the SAME appearance that you define in the myPlayer menu, so you can change it at will if you wish (differs in height depending on your position)
- You can keep playing with your MyCAREER player after you finish the main story, and even use your player for MyPARK

Notes on MyPARK:
- If you're planning on playing this mode, I have found from personal experience that the Sunset Ballers is the most populated with more active players.
- You do NOT need to spend money on VC to be able to play well
- Sometimes you'll come across players who won't play with you or drop out when you enter a court queue because you have a low rating -- don't let this discourage you just keep looking and you'll find some nice players who will play :)
- Not sure if this is the case for everyone, but there is a tiny button delay; just be aware of it --  Also if you find that your controller disconnects when you enter a game, try restarting your game in Steam Big Picture mode

Have not tried MyGM yet, MyTEAM is okay but It's difficult to find a match unless you private match with someone.

9.5/10

reviewText:
Mycareer mode story is not even close to as imersive or nice as 2k15. You can select a nickname after your first season, but you will still be called Freq. The story has no choices until second season of pro, at which the game is the same choices as 2k15. The main character is likeable, but most of the side characters are not. Your best friend is an unlikeable jerk, your manager a stereotype, the owner is the devil, your twin sister and parents may or may not match your skin color(honestly those characters are cool), and the girlfriend is kinda just there.

The Mycareer mode now has game days and offdays, which is a nice change added to break up games. The new way to get upgrades by consistently going to practice on off days is also nice. You can also see upcoming endorcement offer to plan accordingly. All in all improvement from 2k15. This is also the only not online gamemode I have played.

The online is full of blantent hackers who get away with murder. If you want to fight them legit, be prepared to farm all the badges and atribute points you can. They seem to not be doing anything to stem the flow of hackers. I had personal issue with their customer support taking forever to reply and giving me the run around, until eventually saying they can't do anything. At least the courts are nice to look at. Between the Rough Riders, Flyers, and Ballers, only the ballers court seems to stay full.

Gets 6/10 for Bad online and mediocre story, but extra points for trying to improve. Do not buy on PC if you plan on playing legitly online. If you plan on playing by hacking, please unplug you computer and walk away.

reviewText: Supposedly one of the greatest sports game in history is actually one of the most bs games in 2k history. Controls are all changed from what everyone is used to. The pick and rolls are now even harder to perform as the center or power forward takes a while to get into position or sets a screen for only a miniscule of a second. Shooting is disgusting because even the tiniest bit shy off of a perfect release or over would result in a miss, even in a situation where it's the most wide open shot. Passing is the same as usual, you try to pass to one guy but will pass to someone all the way across the court. Zig zag cheese is not gone as the CPU now zig zags you into their picks. In conclusion, the new mechanics of the game is what is actually ruining the gameplay and improvement was mainly focused on the different modes rather than gameplay itself.

reviewText:
First and foremost: They gameplay is awesome and anyone who loves basketball will love NBA 2K16.

So why would I NOT recommend this game?
Publisher 2K simply doesn't care about its community enough. The MyTeam Domination mode is not working for pc players for about 2 weeks now because of a problem on 2K's side. There is 0 information on if or when it is going to be fixed. 2K won't even admit publicly that there is a problem in the first place. The support team is unable (or unwilling) to help and the community management absolutely fails to communicate with the player base. And that's only the icing on the cake. Since the beginning, there are a lot of cases of players losing their MyCareer character because of a corrupted safe file and not getting any compensation even if they bought their VC with real money or heavy lag online which basically persists since NBA2K13.

So sadly I can absolutely not recommend NBA 2K16 even though it is an incredibly fun game simply because 2K gives a ♥♥♥♥ about its playerbase.

reviewText:
NBA 2k16 has incredible graphics, gameplay is generally very smooth, and server performance is vastly improved from recent years.  However, there are an insane amount of small issues that add up and these have all been here since release, that makes gameplay very frustrating.

Many features are incomplete, or just dont work.  Directional passing for example, there is no way to pass to a player behind another player without manually selecting that player and allowing the defense time to react.  every second counts in basketball.

VIP Stats (their online stats program) shows in depth tendencies and stats about the opponent you play at the loading screen, but there is no way to see any stats besides PPG and Win/Loss for your own profile, when they obviously have the information available to them.

Whenever a stoppage of play occurs there is a period of time where you are stuck just watching a cutscene, no matter how badly you want to skip, you cannot.  This happens at literally every single stoppage of play, and for me is the most infuriating part of the game when I am trying to play a fast paced game.

Play Now Online allows players to choose their own jersey before they match up with another player, so if a player chooses a white home jersey before they match up with me, gets the Away team, and then doesnt change their jersey I will have no idea that he is using a white jersey instead of what should be a colored jersey since he is the Away team.  This means both teams in game have nearly identical jerseys and the game is so frustrating to play when you have to really stare to see who is on which team in transition.

MyGM and MyLeague have a multitude of options, but lack very basic NBA rules such as the veterans minimum, and protected picks, the latter completely destroying any hopes of a MyGM or MyLeague with the Lakers without cheating and force trading their top 3 pick.   You can sign Steve Nash for 725k or so but in real life he cannot be paid less than $1.49m if he were to sign a contract

At times gameplay AI seems random, for example there seems to be a 50% chance that on a transisition you pass the ball to your teammate he will either stand still and catch it or keep running and theres no way to know what will happen.

On offense the AI actually sometimes feels like it is rigged against you, with your players playing either unrealisticly or flat out refusing to obey controller commands.   Example:  shooters that have a wide open 3 go inside the line and when I try to get them to go behind the line (and this has happened many times for me), they literally just wont go behind the line I dont get it.

Defensive AI feels the same way.  Double team is set to manual but they still decide to leave their 3pt shooter wide open to double team someone who doesnt need to be double teamed, and wasnt told to double team

2K puts no effort in updating hairstyles of players, with the majority of players having the same hair they had in summer 2015 when they got scanned, and there have been lots of changes during the season.  Allen Crabbe is one example thats not even close to real life anymore

MyCareer is terrible the first season is garbage the High School and College experience comes off as annoying and tedious since none of it matters at all there is no story that changes its the same thing every time, so after youve made your first player its just annoying to go thru it all over again to get to NBA.

Cannot stress how bad MyCareer is we were told that we were going to Be The Story, and that couldnt be farther from the truth.  Its Freq's Career by Spike Lee for the entire first season, you only get to play 8 rookie games!!

Every single game of Online play you will have to change your settings, they just do not save and there is no way to get them to default to something else.  This functionality does not work and has not worked for years.  It even changes the camera angle so if you dont get the first possession you have to play in Broadcast mode until you get the ball.

In MyGM, MyLeague, and MyCareer, your gameplay settings (length, difficulty, sliders) all have to be set every single time you make a new franchise/career no matter what the default settings are.  The default settings seem to only make a difference in Play Now offline.

Getting locked in animations.  Just ridiculous there are so many long animations in this game ESPECIALLY after scoring a bucket and celebrating your opponent can run the ball up court while you watch your player dancing and celebrating in the backcourt.   Just terrible.  Awful.   My controller actions are not suggestions they are commands

If your controller gets disconnected during online play, you cannot reconnect it under any circumstances and have to restart 2k in order to be able to play it further.  This will always result in a loss unless its late in the game and you have a comfortable lead and waste the clock playing with your keyboard.  But idk even 1 control for that

MyCareer doesnt allow Draft classes.  cant think of any reason to not include this.  It also doesnt allow GM sliders so the trades and Free agency are unrealistic in MyCareer mode


Overall this is a very good basketball game, but the tiny problems make it infuritating to play



As we unfortunately have to ask every single year in the 2k community,

PLEASE FIX YOUR GAME

reviewText:
Do not buy if you only play MyCareer
Coming from a longtime 2K Sports fan, I have mixed feelings on this entry of NBA2K. However, just because I have it not recommended I suggest you read the entire review to see if you would like it.

I am not going to get into day one issues like crashes, bugs, and server issues because frankly basing a review off that this early before they can fix things is stupid. But there are issues I PERSONALLY have with the game. But I'll say a few things this game offers over 2K15 first.

ProsImproved animations definitely.
Finally readded create-a-team for MyGM, MyLeague, MyTeam, and other online modes. (And its actually really good)

reviewText:
Really disappointed in the MyCareer mode, which is the only mode I played in this and 2k15.  It is a huge regression from last year for a number of reasons due to the way the story was put in place.  The biggest issues:

1)  In your rookie NBA season, you only play 8 games.  After those 8 games, you move on to your sophomore season where you can then play a full 82 game season.  At this point, the game has sent players all over the place in free agency, so the teams are totally different than what they will be this season.  So for instance, I cannot play more than 8 games without Tim Duncan retiring.

2)  The story is really stupid and feels forced upon you.  The team isn't sure about signing you because you are friends with Vic."  Are you kidding?  And no matter how well you play
date: you get this way over-dramatic storyline that detracts from simply being a rookie trying to make it in the NBA.\n\n3)  There just simply isn't enough content in this game that responds to how you play in your games.  There were plenty of cut scenes in 2k15 that would cater to your performance.  For instance
recommended: the coach would call you in and congratulate you for your rebounding effort or how you distribute the ball to your teammates.  In this game I haven't seen any of that (though maybe I just haven't played long enough to see it).  All of the cut scenes in 2k16 play out just like a movie (a downright terrible one).  I play games for an immersive
hoursPlayed: interactive experience where my play affects the outcome.  This game is not that at all."

reviewText:
Let's set this straight, the gameplay itself is fun and well polished when it's working.  However the amount of bugs along with ♥♥♥♥♥♥ MyCareer really forces me to not recommend this game.  The online works fine for the most part, no real connection issues, ProAm and all of those things are a nice addition.   I had a HUGE issue when I first started playing the game, I went into the graphic options and messed around.  I DISABLED V-sync and dynamic V-sync along with all of this, after applying the changes, the game froze and crashed.  So I then restarted the game and it began to run at 1FPS, luckily I remembered that 2k15 had a similar problem albiet less intense.  So I went into appdata/roaming and opened up the config file, only to see that the v-sync options were still enabled. I disabled those and launched the game again, now running at 200fps.

List of bugs I've encountered:
-FPS issue above
-When subbing back in during MyCareer the player info pane never appears, forcing me to quit to the menu and reload
-Player is litterally stuck in an animation when a pass or rebound is taken away at the wrong time.  You have to wait till the possesion is over
-Some freethrows count for 2 points, then resulting in the team shooting to get the ball back.
-The menu when you choose to either hang out/train or advance get's stuck on screen DURING the game

If 2k patched out those problems the game wouldn't necessarily be better, just less annoying to play.  MyCareer is ♥♥♥♥, no real choices like they advertised, and you still have to pay for ♥♥♥♥ing accessories like socks with VC.  I only bought this game because it was on sale at GMG.  If it was full price, no way in hell would I have bought it.  There are just not enough changes to justify the full price for this game.

reviewText:
Pros:
*Better animations than previous versons.

Cons:

This game just leaves me wanting more."

reviewText:
Feels like a F2P game with all the trappings of P2W.

Want to improve your MyPlayer?
Buy VC.
Want to improve another MyPlayer at a different position?
Buy VC.
Want to advance in MyGM?
Buy VC.
Want to collect MyTeam cards?
Buy VC.

Or spend hundreds of hours earning VC at a paltry rate only to see it vanish quickly as upgrading is prohibitively expensive. Playing online is unrewarding due to a low online population and VC being so critical to everything.

Offline mode is fine but not worth the current price. Wait for a sale. Fire up a previous version with an updated roster in the meantime.
