reviewText:
I play the NBA 2k games every year because basketball is my favorite sport and NBA 2k is, unfortunately, the only halfway decent sim on the market.  The problem with this is that they have no pressure to get their ♥♥♥♥ together.

I gave this game a positive review after playing maybe 10 hours because some basic issues with NBA 2k15 were fixed.  The movement feels more fluid than in that game.  NBA 2k15 is without a doubt the worst NBA 2k game ever made.  This is probably the 2nd worst game in the franchise though.  A new review is being written after playing many more hours.  I only play so many hours because I assume problems with the game are my own lack of skill for a bit, until you really get to notice specific problems.  I also just love basketball and keep getting fooled every year.  And it's such a shame because NBA 2k14 on next-gen console, not PC, had such great potential to be improved dramatically in the following years.  They removed all their progress for God knows what reason.

The big draw is that Spike Lee did the MyCareer mode, and frankly it's by far the worst career mode in any sports game I've ever played, or any game with any mode even remotely comparable.  They put you in a Spike Lee film basically, except Spike Lee was obviously not allowed to make something like he'd actually put in a film (most of his films are R rated and this game is E rated, so you can imagine all the things he'd have to censor himself about).

So they make your character's background be this incredibly stereotypical borderline offensive plotline, something which would be called racist if Spike didn't do it because it'd be called a parody of black life in New York.  You use 90s rap slang in a modern setting and have all kinds of ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t happen which doesn't actually move the plot of you being a basketball player forward.  I'm shocked Big Daddy Kane didn't have a writing credit.  You play like 8 games, 4 high school 4 college, to determine your draft slot.  Not a terrible idea by itself.  But they paint your character the whole time as being this godsend of a player.  Think of the way Lebron was anticipated as a kid out of high school.  Yet, if you spend no VC on your character before the draft, he comes in as a 55 overall.  This makes your player the worst in the league, literally.

This is problematic for 2 major reasons: (other than the absurdity of being painted as Lebron and then coming in to be the worst in the league by far).

1) College and high school games are a complete waste of time.  Draft position couldn't matter less in any context, just your own role playing.  I normally care about draft position in these games, but they also usually care more about how I play during MyCareer in return.
2) You cannot skip this for new players.

After you're drafted, they only let you play 8 games of your first season.  It's abysmal.  Also, Spike's story actually has nothing to do with your real NBA career, i.e. the reason you're playing.  All it does is give you 2 hours of cutscenes interspersed between the pointless high school and college games.  There's hardly any actual story once you're a bonafide NBA player, which defeats the entire purpose of the mode.  The only thing you get are meetings" with some select few famous players
date: and that's not actually anything more than clicking on menus and seeing some kind of a stat or VC boost at best.\n\nThe MyGM mode is plagued with the practice time issue.  It becomes a nuissance immediately.  The mode itself is pretty easy
recommended: it's nowhere near as complex as something like Out of the Park Baseball is
hoursPlayed: obviously
voteText: but it's probably as bad as its ever been.  The trade logic
helpfulPercent: despite promises to the contrary
votesHelpful: is equal to how bad it always is.  There's always so many dumb trades you can pull off.  It boggles my mind that the game allows such game breaking trades to be made.\n\nAnd the gameplay itself: again

It defeats the purpose of the meter if you miss midrange jumpers with an 88 overall player on a perfectly in the green shot.\n\nThe game feels like one of those old hockey tabletop games where all the players are stuck to the floor and you can only rotate them to shoot in a puck.  The players feel stuck to the floor.  They are moved against gravitational logic into positions to contest shots in ways which
column17: after watching replays

reviewText:
This is an EXACT clone to 2K15 - the gameplay has changed ZERO.  You still miss every shot, you still drop rebounds, you still get 99% of your passes stolen, you still get dominated in MyTeam and it is impossible to have a good roster to even compete at the start of the game unless you pay about 50 bucks and buy cards.

They did NOTHING to improve the gameplay AT ALL from last year.  All the crappy things you were hoping they would fix, well, they didn't.

The whole Spike Lee movie thing gets boring very, very, very fast and the lines and scenes are embarrassing at best.  It is a black mans world and ghetto trash throughout the entire storyline with all the white people talking in black ghetto accents and seeming to try and fit in to the black world.

This game sucks and I am ♥♥♥♥♥♥ off I got the Jordan version for 79.99 - you get some wack looking shoes, cheap looking shirt and a Jordan jersey that is not worth the extra 20 bucks.

Meh ... I would not buy this if I was you.

reviewText:
Okay, I feel obligated to actually post a review from the standpoint of someone who actually enjoys the game. There are many positives to the game if you play it with the correct mindset. However, with that being said, there are a few issues that are rather annoying when they pop up.

MyCareer- Spike Lee screwed up the mode quite a bit, but once you get past the storyline, it is better than ever. BUT the storyline, is absolutely hilarious due to the fact that I am a white Point Guard who acts not like the average black man, but the average ghetto, uneducated thug. Good for a laugh for sure but definitely a bit unrealistic, considering that you have a black twin sister. It is just a story mode until the end of your rookie season, and then the choice is all yours as to how you do things.

MyTeam- Great gamemode if you put enough time into it. Any game you play will have one or two players who bought their way to skill. There will always be that one guy who just dumped a bunch of money in the game and therefore is automatically at an advantage. The other big problem with player vs player is the fact that there are many ways for you, not neccesarily to have an advantage, but play in a not so polite manner. Spamming three pointers is very easy especially in modes like gauntlet so beware because most people do it. The same goes with Zig-Zagging and other tactics that lead me to question the amount of fun that they might be having. Also the computer is infuriating at every turn. The game is designed to make it challenging, so you will end up missing wide open three pointers and dunks but the computer, somehow dunks on everyone and shoots threes fading over centers. Sucks, but deal with it because there is nothing that you can do to combat it. No matter how good of ball handles your player has, you are prone to suddenly dropping the ball at random points.

Game Quality- So despite the problems I just mentioned, the game itself isn't that bad. If you have an older computer or a lower quality computer, than you may have to lower the game settings in the menu. Does it suck, yes, but you get used to it. Most of the people who have lag and framerate issues are trying to run the game on max settings on a computer that has the gaming ability and power of a microwave. Don't blame the game for your bad computer.

Overview- Worth the buy for sure, but like every game has its issues. You will enjoy the game if you have regular expectations. I love the game and we need more people on the online servers so the game is worth the money.

reviewText:
Extremely too difficult.

I understand you want a realistic basketball sim, but this is ridiculous. I have the difficulty set to pro and I have yet to win a game in MyGM. The AI makes all of their wide open shots, while even if your player is wide open and you hit the shot timer as close as you can, you will still miss. Even if you manage to build a small lead, the AI immediately becomes unstoppable for a few possessions just to even everything out. Making adjustments makes absolutely no difference. The passing controls are garbage, if you are running a play and you try to pass it to the open player it almost never goes to the right player.

I want a realistic basketball game, but I don't want to have to watch youtube tutorials for two weeks before I'm even able to become decent at it. Tone it down 2k.
voteText: 4 of 4 people (100%) found this review helpful

reviewText: Disclaimer: I almost exclusively play MyCareer and MyPark so that's what my review is about. After finishing incredibly boring and distasteful first season (Spike Lee shenanigans), it turns into a pretty good game. Rebounding is seriously improved over the past few editions, and park is better balanced (still not perfect, of course, but at least it's not full of 7'3 people). Stat caps are serious business this time around, and they really help that balance. However, it does mean that you hit the wall pretty early in terms of progression and then it gets really slow afterwards. Graphics are really nice and the game works fine for me in 4k on a single 980ti (60 FPS, no hiccups). Bit of a downside is that MyCareer still doesn't offer proper challenge and balance at higher difficulties. For example on Superstar, my team will simply lose more games than on All-Star, but I am still able to average around triple double (31-11-9) on my All-Around SF in 2nd season. Seems that increasing the difficulty just makes your team miss more, and other team hit absurd shots. But then again, this is really no different than before.

reviewText:
In an interactive media form such as gaming, the my career story has no level of interactivity.  The other characters say that the choice for certain things is all yours but in the end, Spike Lee makes the choices for you and you are just along for the long drawn out CGI movie of a story mode. ( the story is actually a watchable movie at the end.)   Once I saw that, I knew that none of my choices would change the story at all.  This story mode was a bore to play.  Mechanics of the game are good but I guess no one had the courage to stand up to Spike and tell him that the story mode was just straight up bad.

Story Mode: 3/10
Gameplay: 7/10
Overall 5.5/10

I'm going to not recommend this game at the full retail price.  I got it for half off so I can't complain about that too much but for $60, I don't think enough innovation has been made to justify that.

reviewText:
This is a tough review to write because there are some things that are really great about this game and others that are really bad.  First of all, if you don't have a new nvidia card then dont even bother because it is not optimised for anything else.  I have a gtx 970 so i can play it pretty much maxed though.

I am going to talk about the my career mode mainly since thats all I have really played and it is pretty much what I buy 2k for.  The problem with this game is the story kind of ruins it.  Your family is black even if you make a white character and the story is really cheese and you don't actually get any choice in any big decisions for your character.  The cut scenes are 20 min long even though they could be summed up in a 1 min scene.  The story definitely affects your character too much.  You don't get to decide what type  of person you want your player to be- spike lee decides that for you.  He also decides that you will leave college after your first year even though they make such a big deal over what a huge decision it is.  One of the biggest issues is that you dont get to play your rookie year.  You only play 8 games and you have no chance to make the playoffs.  Also, your ratings in this game start out at the lowest ever.  only about a 50 overall.  And best of all, you make no vc at all for the high school or college games.  And since you only play 8 games in your first season, you pretty much go into your second season with that same rating.  I think that this is just greed on 2k's part trying to get you to buy vc because if you didnt preorder the game for the extra 10k vc and you are just playing from the starting rating it is really brutal to try and progresss.  It is basically like taking a middle school kid and throwing him in to play with professionals.  It is really annoying to see this happen in a game that I paid 60 bucks for.  And, after all this hype over the story, it ends after the first season.  The story really ♥♥♥♥ed up this game and I really think 2k should just give you an option to skip it entirely and just play your first season as normal.

So that is a lot of bad stuff so you would think that this would obviously be a negative review however there actaully is a lot of good stuff as well.  Mainly in terms of the actual gameplay which I feel is what matters most.  2k has fixed a lot of the cheese from previous years and I really do feel like the game plays a lot smoother now and all of the animations look a lot better.  The high school and college games are actually done extremley well even though you dont get to play many games.  There is a lot of little details that they took the time to add that really add to the realism of the high school and college games.  You also have a lot more options to customize your player.  The practice mode and the other options of how to spend your off days is a really nice touch except for the fact that the practice mode is stuck in a side view camera that you cannot change (2k PLEASE FIX THIS) which makes some of the drills pretty much unplayable.  I also really like that you have the ability to see contracts from 3 different teams and try to haggle with them to get more vc and minutes.  Another thing I will add is that, in my opinion, the music in this game is a lot better than in previous 2k games.

All in all, there is a lot of bad in this game but I do think 2k pulled through where it really matters which is in the actual gameplay.  And I think that the gameplay is actually so much better than every other 2k game that it makes up for the storyline cheese which is why I gave it a positive review.

reviewText:
I'll admit, Spike Lee's story is a nightmare and lame. The main issue with the story is that it is completely linear and takes away any and all autonomy from the player. Sure, you can pick your college to play at for four games, but that's about it. Everything else is scripted and laid out for you.

However, the story goes by fairly quickly (~8ish hours) and then it's back to the quality basketball experience we've all been used to. Endorsements, trades, connections, etc. all pickup and are normal once the lame story is over.

The controls and player movement is a bit clumsy. Some shots don't fall when they are wide open and definitely should. All that being said, it's still the best basketball game for PC.

tl;dr - lame story that goes by quickly. Quality basketball sim once the story is over. All the hate isn't entirely justified IMO. Some clumsy controls and play, but it's the best basketball game out there for PC.

reviewText:
Bought the game when it went on sale on Jan 30, but have not been able to enjoy the game for 2 weeks.  Everytime I finish a Domination game on MyTeam I get an ''Arbitration is taking too long' error and I lose my game progress BUT I still use up my contracts.

I thought it was a minor blimp, maybe some server problems with the increase traffic because of the sale.  So I tried another game, and another, and another, and another...all still with the same error.  I tried to get a refund but was denied by Steam because I played over 2 hours on my each attempts.

I set up a ticket with 2k Support, this was 2 weeks ago when I started to have this problem, and they still have not came back with an answer, just running me around.  If you look through Reddit  or the Steam forums, you can see this is common for the PC version.

reviewText:
I love the 2k series but I'm seriously considering not buying for PC next season if at all. First of all this release is extremely unstable and as usual 2k is slow to fix the bugs. I've been dealing with framerate issues from launch. They've patched it and now the issues seems to be isolated to playing career mode where the game fluxuates from running fine to speeding up to slowing down. I've tried playing the game with all of the graphical settings on low and I'm seeing the same results.

Aside from the technical issues, I wasn't very happy with the opeing of career mode either. Going from high school to college then the NBA was cool but being forced to watch Spike Lee's preach story was not. I was forced to watch a 20 minute cutscene that I couldn't skip or pause? Ridiculous. I feel that the story had a good moral but came off as forced and preachy. Not to mention the game features another stereotypical portrayal of an Italian American with questionable character that Spike Lee is now becoming known for. I as an African American male can't support all of his views.

On the gameplay front, 2K is still top notch. Controls are again improved. Excellent game on that count. However I'm hoping that another developer starts making A+ basketball games as 2K hasn't been forced to step it up since they have no competition. They need to stop releasing unfinished products.

reviewText:
This game is such a disappointment in terms of the MyCareer mode, I was so hyped leading up to release - I think people have vented that thoroughly, and I agree with them - so I'm not going to bash that aspect anymore.

The other part of the problem for me are the bugs, crashes and overall tardiness of the game. For PC via steam, expect the game to crash.. a lot! My commentary regularly drops out, The scouting and assignment screen sometime just lingers without any actual report coming up, the halftime locker room is sooooo slow to progress, and you can't skip to the evaluation - it skips the whole lot. Trying to skip through timeouts, or substitutions is a nightmare, it takes FOREVER -  and a lot of the time you just have to suck it up and wait through the whole process before getting back to playing.

I do however like the physics of the game, and even enjoy the new controls.. I generally play a big man and use a lot of post moves - so the post up trigger is really working for me. The controls do seem sluggish compared to 2k15, but it may just be the limits they have now put on responsiveness and speed for bigger players. Dunks seem to be easier to perform, my player even with a 55 rating was posterizing everyone.

I also have fallen victim to purchasing the MJ special edition - and played my entire rookie season without any boosts or help with VC... still no indication on when my VC will come through - it's the 29th, I waited till release day.. still waiting.

The game seems to rely, HEAVILY, and I mean HEAVILY on you PURCHASING VC.. the my NBA 2k16 phone app hasn't come out, opportunities to earn VC in other ways are limited... It just really sucks. especially after shelling out for the special edition.

I would recommend everyone stay away from this game until they fix all the bugs. Most ppl are going to hate the MyCareer story I feel - If they fix all the gameplay bugs then the game may be worth purchasing on discount so you can play with your online friends. REFUND REQUESTED!

Not bothering with this game anymore, the gameplay is simply terrible and anyone who states otherwise is playing on Rookie or Pro difficulty. I wish I could get my money back for this; I've been playing every NBA 2K game since 2012 and this one is genuinely the worst.

reviewText:
Game is beautiful, runs well at 4k resolution and the classic teams are great as well.
I liked the game from what I played of it.  If you are a fan of the current NBA roster and teams might be good for you to pick up.

However, for me, I'm just going to stick to 2k11.  As I'm not a pro at the game, and I'm not interested in my player, just team vs team and doing franchise seasons of 83 games 2k11 works for me still.

That game runs at 4k, still looks quite good, though not as realistic as 2k16.

I'm too casual of a player of NBA games to jump to this version.

It piqued my interest because of the Michael Jordan edition, however for an MJ experience 2k11 still wins in that regard with Jordan challenges and the teams included.

I usually buy a 2K bball game every 5 years as usually enough has changed by that time for the game to feel very fresh for me.

Maybe I'll buy 2k17 next year, depends on the changes.

reviewText:
Note: I am a huge basketball fan (been watching basketball since 1999, when I was 4). Also, I've played basketball while growing up and I've played numerous editions of basketball games (ie. NBA live 00-2008; NBA 2k8-16). Because of this, certain aspects of the game I really enjoy may be something that a casual gamer may find frustrating and unenjoyable.

Pros1) the AI GREATLY improved
Unlike previous versions, it no longer takes waggling the right stick to break down the defender. It feels MUCH more rewarding to actually break down the AI defense. The AI will no longer ballhog" on offense either. They will pass the ball and call screens more oftenly forcing you to constantly switch defenders to prevent the open basket.

2)MyGM and MyLeague: Developing Players has gotten much better
Every player now actually has a potential around a B+ rating. Only stars have potentials of an A+/A. This is huge because in the past
date:
any scrub could suddenly be a 90 rated player within 3-4 years. Now some players with a potential of an A may never pan out in the NBA. This feels a lot more realistic.

3)MyGM Level Upgrades are no longer broken
Previously in 2k14-15
recommended: MyGM upgrades were ridiculously broken. For instance
hoursPlayed: there would be badges that add +5 to certain attributes (which is HUGE). In 2k16
voteText: the upgrades are toned down preventing your team from ALWAYS finishing first. In the previous games
helpfulPercent:
this was SOOOO bad that you could take 50-60 rated players and go on 6 peats with them.

4)New Cap Introduced
2k added the new cap space. Basically to TL;DR it
votesHelpful:
the new deal the NBA has is a TV deal that raises the cap space. This is the reason why currently there are NBA players who are mostly role players with large contracts (in comparison to the past). The new TV deal makes the contract percentage wise smaller. This is in MyLEague and MyGM.

5)RELOCATION
You can relocate your team and redesign everything about it from the sounds that go off during a game to the logo and the jerseys.

6)MyPlayer - Season 2 and beyond
MyPlayer after season 1 is better than previous versions. You can choose what to do on a daily basis. You no longer feel forced into certain interactions. They also reintroduced contract negotiations (which I have not seen since 2k13). Basically
votesTotal:
you're able to negotiate for either higher minutes or higher salary with teams interested in you. Push too hard and these teams may back out.

7)MyPlayer - High School and College
Difficulty goes up as you move up (ie. in the first game of HS
votesFunny: you can score like 40 points without even trying but in college
commentsCount:
you actually have to try). Kinda fun to smash on HS kids and feel like a God for a few games. College is interesting because we haven't had a basketball college game since CH 2k8 and NCAA 2010 so... yeah.

Cons
1)Livin' Da Dream
Seriously
column16: this is THE worst storyline ever created. It's cringeworthy AF. You play as Freq
column17: a kid from a black family from Harlem who basically moves up from being a local talented phenom to a rising star in the NBA. No matter what race YOU are
column18: you're stuck with this black family. Cutscenes were long
column19: dragged out
column20:
and made it FEEL like you had power to control what was going on but you really don't. Only good thing about this was that 2k allows you to skip the cutscenes.

2)MyGM and MyLeague contracts
Yeah... players are signing for way too little. For instance
column21: in 2025 there was a new TV deal that allowed me to sign players for more money. Playing as the Timberwolves
column22:
KAT signed a 5 year contract for $20 million a year. This was ridiculously low in comparison to other players who signed $40 mill a year contracts. Note that KAT was a 93 overall. His signing was so low I was able to bring in like 3-4 more star players. Kinda ruins the realism as you're forced to play with House Rules (ie. force a huge contract on KAT to make it seem more "realistic" or not sign mult. star players)

3)MyPlayer - VC reliant compared to the past
In the past
column23: you were able to just play MyPlayer without spending a dime. I was forced to grind MyGM games and the My2K Mobile Game to get VC. You start as a 59 rookie. In comparison
column24: most other rookies are in the 70s. The game feels kinda weak because of this. You're always touted to be the "next great thing" and you can barely dribble the ball without it bouncing off of your foot.... Yeah
column25:
some HoFer you are.

4)Online is dead
Not really blaming 2k for this as the majority of the community plays on the PS4 and the Xb1. I've played a grand total of 1 Play Online game and it took about 10 minutes of searching to even get in. Unless you plan on playing with a friend
column26: I don't recommend the online at all.\n\n5) Bugs

6)Kinda unfriendly to Noobs
Common since 2k15 (can't really remember if it was in 2k14) instead of a mentor-training system teaching you the controls

reviewText: Ya know, after NBA 2k15 (which was IMO the best basketball game made in a long time) I was very excited for this game.  I read the reviews, which a lot of them were negative.  Well, I have major regrets that I didn't listen to the reviews.  THIS GAME IS FLAT OUT HORRIBLE!!!  It seems like the devolopers spent all their time on the story portition & no time at all on the actual game play of the game.  The game play is just awful!  The players move very slow, which means you will lose your guy on defense very easliy (even in turbo mode).  The controller settings are a little different from 2k15, so you'll have to get used to them.  When you pick your player on the court, it feels like you're a robot & not a player.  NBA 2k15 was much different.  You felt like an actual player on the court and were a part of the game, not just some robot running around (slowly) not doing much.  I was going to return it, but I thought maybe I was being to critical, so I gave it more and more chances.  Now I can't return it, and I will most likely go back to NBA 2k15.  This pisses me off, because I want the roster to be up to date, but I guess I gotta sacrafice a new roster for better (a lot better) gameplay.  I don't know what the developers were thinking releasing this crap.  Next time I'm going to listen to the reviews...  ;(
voteText: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
MyCareer 2k15>2k16

Ok, so I bought the game on the release. It didn't work. I couldn't play the game for atleast a month. I had to be in touch with the customer service with 3-4 diffenrent people which got annoying during time because I had to explain what I had done etc. to each person. The fault was 2Ks. They fixed the bugs after awhile so I could play and I was disapointed.

I am playing MyCareer only and loved the nba 2k15 MyC, it was visually good, gameplay was fun and you could be the hero who made the shots that were ment to actually go in. This year I desided to make a Shooting Guard, who was just focused on shooting. My SG is now 81 overall, 85 shooting, 50layup, passing 40 or something.

1. Shooting (85). I can't make any shots that are open. This shooter shouldn't be in the nba, fact. I haven't even tried to do contact shots since I can't even make open shots. (tried different animations Kobe, Klay and some free ones. Didn't have any impact. Simulation, default, casual doesn't matter. I tried if the sliders worked, nothing. And I'm playing on Superstar, im no rookie, HoF in 2k15)

2. Layups. This guy should definetly not be in the nba. This guy misses every layup even on a fast break alone and he manages to miss a layup. 50 layup shouldn't be that critical on that point.

3. Passing. Man I can make every pass. Don't boost your passing skill since it is useless. (Unless you want to make traffic lobs)

4. Dripple. It's so sluggish. Dripple is extremely hard because the guy doesn't follow your controls at all. (Can be fixed with dirrenent animations, maybe? But if this is true, 2K, delete the rest of the animations because they are useless so stop making more of them)

Spike Lee start off was kinda boring since it didn't have any inpact on the gameplay, just some random cutscenes.

2K, You really don't have to make the game more realistic" with the scoring % because it makes the game extremely unrealistic when you can't make buckets that even I would do under preassure and exhaustion. I don't even play basketball. 2k15 to 2k16 was just a cheese fix patch.

If you are considering buying this game
date: don't do it. Online is fun but if you want to play MyCareer it will ♥♥♥♥ you the f off. 2k15 was great and I'm going to start playing that instead of this. Maybe 2k17 will be better
recommended: who knows? Listen to the community before you buy it though. I wasted my 50e and I actually regret it.\n\nNBA fan from Finland"

reviewText: Having been a huge NBA 2K fan (I have put in more than 100 hours into each iteration for the past 6 years), this years is a HUGE disappointment.  The new soap opera that is My Player is beyond corny and unrelatable.  The one thing that this games is supposed to be about is basketball, however in the first season I was only allowed to play 8 games and had what felt like 3 hours of unwatchable cutscenes.  The lack of playing has left my player still in the 50's as I am unable to improve the player if I can't play with him.  I've only played this game for a handful of hours but I am ready to uninstall and spend my time on something that I will actually enjoy.  I kept coming back to this series due to the MyPlayer mode, however this year you have the least control over your player and they made it a joke.  Unless this changes goodbye NBA 2K.

reviewText:
What do you get when you buy this game?

The same exact game as last year.

MyGM, MyLeague, and the rest of the modes are exactly the same right on down to the graphics in the data screens. The only difference is the MyCareer mode they did all the advertisement on with Spike Lee, but it's really really REALLY bad. Literally the worst ♥♥♥♥ ever. I had a feeling the Spike Lee thing would fail hard and it did. No choices at all for you to make in a mode that is supposed to be MyCareer." Spike Lee wrote a script and they force your player down the road of his ill-written gibberish.

They don't even allow you to choose the NBA team you begin your career on
date: taking away some of the freedom you had in the previous game. And the first 7 games you play in High School and College go 100% unrewarded. You don't get any gold to improve your player and drafted out of college you are the worst player in the NBA alongside being the worst rookie out of your draft class. The first NBA season of your career? Lasts 8 games. And you are rewarded with very little gold
recommended: forcing you towards microtransactions even harder in order to make your NBA player be able to compete with the rest of the League.\n\nThis is the first game I'll request a refund from in my life on Steam. I'm disgusted and ashamed. 2k has really dropped the ball here."

reviewText:
This is an amazing game, if you can deal with the issues that sets this game a step back. First of all, gameplay is great. Most of  the player movement is realistic but there are few animations that are apsurd and some exploits that some users take advantage of, and of course cheaters. MyCareer was interesting when played for the 1st time but it is very repetitive and boring at times.

Pro Am is fantastic, in somewhat ways. The worst part of it is that if you want to play Pro Am solo is very difficult to find players, especially during day because it has really terrible matchmaking. This is the worst part of the whole NBA and is needed to be addressed in future releases. Making something like general chat in each game mode is the key to improving the gameplay for players.

All of the above said is really a small part of this game and is ignorable because this game has so many great features which you will enjoy like never before, and I am saying this after playing since NBA 2k9.

reviewText:
So I've managed to play this game a little more and I really don't like it. I played 2K14, and thought it was ok. I play it solely from a MyCareer standpoint, and the MyCareer in this one does have a better story than 2k14, but it drags on in the cutscenes and you don't make any decisions for your life outside of basketball. The voice acting is good, but the animations and expressions often don't fit, and that's not a fault to the actors, its just down to shoddy graphics.

The gameplay itself has actually downgraded since 2K14. The AI behind the players is even more stupid, and the controls are even worse. I found my player switching positions with the target he was supposed to guard, despite the fact he was supposed to playing hard defense. Wide open shots that should go in, just don't. The shot timing is a little more aggravating in this game than 2k14, and in 2k14 it could be rather aggravating. The only good thing is the updated rosters from what I saw.

All in all, don't get it unless you really want to play basketball, but are either too lazy to play real basketball or are tired from playing it.

reviewText:
NBA 2K16 is a great game, like its previous titles, but I'm giving it a negative review simply for the fact that the developers don't seem to fix the bugs that persisted through their previous titles. As well as some few good things that they don't seem to keep from their previous titles.

1. Commentators cut off during the game sometimes. Commentary starts again at the next quarter.

2. Referees sometimes just sit there with the ball for half a minute before giving it to you.

3. There also seems to be problems with the VC sometimes not reaching the server properly.

4. (Personal) I want the option to make a fantasy team with just the playoffs, whether it be MyGM or MyLeague. This was done in a previous 2K title. I don't know why they got rid of the option.

Overall, almost nothing has changed from 2k15. I mean, there were a few changes that has inevitably made the game better (ie. speed mechanics, blocking fouls are now shooting fouls), and I understand that graphically theres only so much more they can do.

It feels like there's way too much emphasis on MyCareer, if ONLY for the fact they earn more money from it. I would love to give you more money for your titles, if you released a title worthy of it. This to me tells me that the developers don't care much for the fans except for their money, and how to exploit that fact. But honestly this game is just 2k15 with different controls. Please at least fix the bugs before releasing your next game.

reviewText:
(September 27th 2015)

Right now, I can't recommend buying NBA 2k16. Keywords: Right now. Although the gameplay is better than recent installments, and the gamemodes continue to improve, the PC Port has a myriad of issues I can't recommend anyone go through without waiting for a fix.

First of all, the game crashes. A lot. I mean, a lot. Sometimes you click on options, it crashes. You edit a player, it crashes. It's completely random but not uncommon at all.

Second, the menus are horribly designed and even have glitches where regardless of restarting the game you can't see things under a black screen. Example: I play primarily MyGM mode, and the relocation features are fantastic, but break nearly every time I try to use them. You can't change uniforms, arena designs, or anything even if you restart. I haven't even had luck with creating a new MyGM file. This is completely inexcusable and ruins the game when things literally don't work.

And third, the gameplay optimization is very very poor. It runs dedicated graphics, instead of your graphics card. You have to manually change the setting to nvidia (in my experience) via the control panel on my computer. My laptop is pretty nice, I do solid gaming on it (950M Nvidia, 16 gb RAM, i7, it's brand new) and it chugs sometimes. I literally have no clue why, even after turning down the settings. I really think that based on the Steam reviews 2K will have to take a look at the PC port and fix issues with it on their own.

If these issues are fixed soon, I definitely recommend the game as a whole. It has everything, it's just that some of it doesn't work.

reviewText:
The basketball so far has been excellent.  The story in My Career has not.  Anyone familiar with Spike Lee's previous work can guess what it is: Preachy ghetto story that has been told 1000 times.  The whole thing is just very very cheesy.  All credit to the actors for trying to salvage the script, but they really had their work cut off for them.

I've just realised the first 3 lines of my review sound like a review on iMDB.  So..... basketball.

It's a lot more fluid, the players have a better sense of weight, and it just feels right.  Controls have been changed quite a bit with more passing options, and after a while I really like the change.

Presentation is very good, and I love the post game show (whenever I quit early Shaq seems to give me a filthy look).

Sound is a bit wonky though, and I have had a few odd bugs where the sound goes a bit mental.  Otherwise, it's technically fine turned up to the max.

If you love basketball you'll enjoy this.  If you can suffer through the god awful story the My Career is actually quite engaging.  Thankfully you can skip the cutscenes.

Oh, and get used to being called Freak (Freq? whatever).

I mean seriously Spike. Frequency Vibrations?  Really?  I swear you ran a competition in local primary schools and a local 8 year old kid thought that up.  At least I hope that's the reason.

Signing off as I'm ranting.

reviewText:
I was thinking whether to give the game a positive or a negative vote.  I've played a lot of basketball simulations and in this case, NBA 2k16 is certainly one of the, if not THE best game ever to be released. Why the hesitation, then, u might ask. Well, 3 months have passed since the release of the game and it's the first time when it's fully playable (in my terms).  What's happenned? Looks like 2K Sports decided to give us an incomplete product and made us pay for the beta-testing of it. I'm pretty mad about this fact, and I'm not sure if I wanna' do it again. Probably not. Not to be baseless, I'll give you some examples of my negative experience with the game:
-invisible players, not allowing me to do almost anything against them since their actions are unpredictable(on- and offline)
-fps drops
-sound stopping in the middle of the game, not returning at all, or after a few quarters
-lots of connection problems with the servers
-black, instead of colourful floors of the arenas, 3pt line not visible
-gameplay things like still being defended hardly after passing the rival in animation.
And I haven't even played the MyCareer and other modes than Exhibition, as I'm not that much interested in them, so I've got no clue how many errors are awaiting me in there. After all, the gameplay is really, really nice (but that's what we got used to when playing 2k sport games). Nonetheless, this is the first time when those errors have occurred, and I suppose I can't give the game a positive vote. Maybe next year. Maybe...

reviewText:
I can not speak for the individuals who bought and played this game before the patches came out but the game in its current state, which is the time of this writing is superb.

I have not played myplayer yet but the core gameplay has been refined with new shooting mechanics, new player animations, new presentation (which the game already had the best presentation already), the shots seem to go into the net more swiftly than before. The graphics which were great have even been updated to make the game look and appear even more crisp. This is a different game than 2k15 and it can't be denied. The game in its state is worth the 30 bucks to upgrade in my fair opinion.

Id definitely recommend this game right now.

I would also like to add that this game is optimized to the teeth. I get max 144 fps with 970 sli. That is scaling and optimization mastery.

reviewText:
I've played it in the free weekend, and I have to say it's a lot more fun than I had expected.

Yes there are some bugs. For example I got stuck in the sub bench when there was a goal scored and my player ran of field. I glitched myself out and luckily my team was attacking, else we would've been a man short defending which is a big problem with basketball.

Gameplay is really good, although I really don't get the hang of the defending and good dribbles. But that is probably my own mistake by being not experienced with these NBA games for a long time. Also I didn't play with actual teams a lot, and started out with a self made player. So that's probably a big factor as well.

The story line in my career is pretty fun, but I got really tired over the pre game shows and after shows. First few times it's not that bothering, unless you play a few hours after each other. Yes it is nice when they talk about you, but I just want to play.

All in all I think people who like basketball will like this game as well. I think the biggest bugs are solved(?), since the sub bench thing only happened at the start of the play and then never again. Didn't really experience any major bugs further or crashes. So yeah, I'd reccommend this game if you're a basketball fan, if not you should wait for the next sale.

reviewText: My Career is a joke.  They give you no chance at being semi decent in your first season, and the 'practices' in the second season are garbage.  Spike Lee's story doesn't add to the value, especially when it is obviously built around you being a member of the black harlem community and the character you build does not fit into that scheme, *cough* *cough*.  Defending a player is terrible, you will be playing perfect defense for ten seconds and then the guy somehow blows by you and the 'my career' grade for the game is destroyed by one misstep.  It also dings you for not covering your guy when the arrow at the bottom of your character is changing its mind every 1/2 second as to who you should be covering.  But heaven forbid the arrow is pointing at the character that ends up making the shot, thats your fault.\n\nThe gameplay in general is still good.  It just has weird quirks on defense

reviewText:
I can not speak for the individuals who bought and played this game before the patches came out but the game in its current state, which is the time of this writing is superb.

I have not played myplayer yet but the core gameplay has been refined with new shooting mechanics, new player animations, new presentation (which the game already had the best presentation already), the shots seem to go into the net more swiftly than before. The graphics which were great have even been updated to make the game look and appear even more crisp. This is a different game than 2k15 and it can't be denied. The game in its state is worth the 30 bucks to upgrade in my fair opinion.

Id definitely recommend this game right now.

I would also like to add that this game is optimized to the teeth. I get max 144 fps with 970 sli. That is scaling and optimization mastery.

reviewText:
I was thinking whether to give the game a positive or a negative vote.  I've played a lot of basketball simulations and in this case, NBA 2k16 is certainly one of the, if not THE best game ever to be released. Why the hesitation, then, u might ask. Well, 3 months have passed since the release of the game and it's the first time when it's fully playable (in my terms).  What's happenned? Looks like 2K Sports decided to give us an incomplete product and made us pay for the beta-testing of it. I'm pretty mad about this fact, and I'm not sure if I wanna' do it again. Probably not. Not to be baseless, I'll give you some examples of my negative experience with the game:
-invisible players, not allowing me to do almost anything against them since their actions are unpredictable(on- and offline)
-fps drops
-sound stopping in the middle of the game, not returning at all, or after a few quarters
-lots of connection problems with the servers
-black, instead of colourful floors of the arenas, 3pt line not visible
-gameplay things like still being defended hardly after passing the rival in animation.
And I haven't even played the MyCareer and other modes than Exhibition, as I'm not that much interested in them, so I've got no clue how many errors are awaiting me in there. After all, the gameplay is really, really nice (but that's what we got used to when playing 2k sport games). Nonetheless, this is the first time when those errors have occurred, and I suppose I can't give the game a positive vote. Maybe next year. Maybe...

reviewText: You know what I’m not even gonna be nice to this game. The story line makes no sense, the characters are dull and annoying, people keep calling your character Freq which makes you feel like you’re not playing as yourself but some dumb ♥♥♥♥ guy with a dumb ♥♥♥♥ nickname. Your whole rookie season is practically wasted, Vic and his crazy idiocy just makes me want to punch my monitor. Your character’s sister is ♥♥♥♥ing annoying, she wants to control everything, she even called Freq’s girlfriend a GOLD DIGGER when she herself is making money off her brother. Speaking of Freq’s family, they are all ♥♥♥♥ing black and so if your character is white you’ll have a ♥♥♥♥ing twin sister who’s black, what were they thinking? When you go from college to pro you’re agent kept talking like you had a choice to stay in college if you want to. The cut scene ends with Freq saying I’ll think about it but next, BAM you’re in the ♥♥♥♥ing NBA draft. This year’s draft was horrible they just went through it with pictures of the drafted players. Then everybody around you keep talking about how Vic is a bad influence but they don’t give us a choice to continue to be friends with Vic, they ♥♥♥♥ing killed him off for Christ sake, what’s the point of those cut scenes then? There was one scene where Freq had a long talk with Vic in the car and NOTHING ♥♥♥♥ing happened! They talked a lot of ♥♥♥♥ which ended so awkwardly and makes you feel like what the ♥♥♥♥ have I just watched for 10 minutes??? WHAT THE HELL HAPPENED? Everything about this story sucks! Most importantly how are some people ok with that ♥♥♥♥ing Frequency Vibration ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t? I thought this is supposed to me MyCareer, all we got was a ♥♥♥♥ing Freq Career or some horse ♥♥♥♥. I had absolutely no ♥♥♥♥ing say for my character. I’ll be honest this is the WORST MyCareer I have ever seen! To sum up, the entire story was nothing but lama ♥♥♥♥ talk, the characters were boring and ♥♥♥♥ing annoying, the cut scenes were so long and pointless, the ending was that your ♥♥♥♥ing friend died from a car crash. What is Spike Lee trying to say?\nAside from the story, the gameplay in MyCAREER sucks as well, you start off as pretty good player in high school, then in college you might start experiencing some difficulties to play as good, then in the NBA you’re a complete ♥♥♥♥-tard who has a 55 overall rating. I had to redo the game, buy a lot of VC and boost up my player to about an 80 overall. I play as a 6’8 small forward and holy ♥♥♥♥ I can only max out my speed to a 70. Like really bruh 70, Kevin Durant’s way taller than 6’8 and he don’t run that slow. ♥♥♥♥ing 70 man how am I suppose to chase down a fast break or something. One ♥♥♥♥ing thing, I had this 80 rating before my first high school game. And in high school and college I was fast, but after I got into the NBA I suddenly became slow as ♥♥♥♥, what the ♥♥♥♥ is wrong with the people who made this game. How can a player suddenly decrease so much speed when they transit to pro, where’s the logic. And ♥♥♥♥ if you’re teammate is wearing then number you want to wear you can’t ♥♥♥♥ing wear it like previous installments.\n2K, I have never been so let down and ♥♥♥♥♥♥ playing your game. I am writing this review because I’ve been playing since 2K7 and I really have NEVER EVER EVER been so disappointed. I genuinely love NBA 2K but seriously what the ♥♥♥♥ happened this year, you guys completely took the hype and ♥♥♥♥ on our faces. This is the worst MyCareer I’ve ever seen you guys don’t even let us choose our body types anymore.

Got crazyass squad, players from 87-95 ovrl THE ELITE STRAIGHT FROM NBA. LBJ can't make contact layup over smaller defender. REALLY ?! HE SHOULD'VE DUNK THE BALL AND THIS GUY INTO THE RIM !!!

Tell me WHY amethyst Steph Curry (MVP Version), can't make open 3 (like two in the row? it's hard for him? - I'm not talkin about one game, it's regular). Game full of scripts like shooting threes 3/5 so its like MAKE,MISS,MAKE,MISS,MAKE, and then missing almost all shots and going 4/13 in game. Can't go 5/5, or get any green release after 3/5 with the best shooter in the history. AGAIN REALLY ?!

Though on the opposite team, Diamond Dwight Howard from Magic can hit free throws like a crazy mother♥♥♥♥**. HOW IS IT EVEN POSSIBLE? Had seen those type of situations with my players like Ben Wallace, and he's making 8/8. Don't remember when he did it in real life. Maybe once, but not few times going through the seed...

I'm so fired up right now, I almost broke my controller and almost rage quit.
Now I know, don't want to waste my time, PLAYING THIS GAME IS NOT PLEASURE FOR ME ANYMORE. I MEAN FU** THIS GAME. Graphics and all the stuff ain't ♥♥♥♥ .
I'm definetely not buying 2k17 copy, I'm not that dumb, and I recommend you to do so. I got respect for my own money.

reviewText:
Honestly here's my advice... wait for 2K17 and hope for the best...
Or buy 2K15 for dirt cheap. At this point 2K16 isn't worth it.
Here's why:

-It's buggy... to put it simply, it has more performance problems than the previous year
-Commentators cut out randomly in games, music sometimes plays and sometimes doesn't, and honsetly... while I'm talking about music... the playlist is pretty weak at points
-The players respond to your actions and commands soooo slowly... you flick the stick right and ♥♥♥♥ing curry responds like hes stuck in the mud or he's as quick as my 92 year old great grandmother.
-Btw I love the spin move. This game will make you dislike it, loathe it, hateeeee it because of how slowly it responds.
-Shot timing is considerably slower and harder to get used to then on a console
-2K added cool features for this year's game, but then cut tons of corners in places like arena design and other things
-The Spike Lee career mode story was cool, interesting to follow, sure, but I have two major problems. One: (nobody go and cry about this now it's a fact) the story mode is designed and intended only for a black audience. Typical Spike Lee ladies and gents. I understand exactly why he was chosen to do this, but cmon. There's a huge audience that gets the story mode ruined for them because it makes no sense at all. I've got a pastey white, blonde-haired girly boy point guard who has a ghetto twin sister and speaks like DMX taught him the language. Second major problem with the career mode: IT SKIPS THE ♥♥♥♥ING ROOKIE SEASON. Any player development, records, acheivements, personal accomplishments, forget it, all of it gets condensed into 8 unfulfilling games. The game lets you play 8 games of your rookie season while bouncing back and fourth between the games and the Spike Lee story. The Career mode is amazing after the stupid Spike Lee distraction is over. I ould have a much less sour opinion if it didn't bite a chunk out of the actual game...

reviewText:
Has some legitimate improvements over 2k15. Would recommend based on my initial reactions.

MyGM/Franchise has re-introduced 3-way trades and made some minor changes to add to the realism (promises to the GM now have consequences, trades destroy chemistry, staff contracts are negotiated, etc.).

Gameplay feels tighter than in the past. Shooting is far more difficult, but that seems fair. The timing of button presses and appropriate spacing is now an aquired skill rather than automatic. Players respond better to inputs and the sense of control seems more legit.

Ernie and Shaq are back, but now Kenny joins them on the desk. Add in Barkley next year, and it'll be worth it just for the pre-game/haltime/post-game shows.

MyCareer is actually a lot of fun. There's a lot more interaction than in 2k15 in terms of what to do on off-days and how to earn Virtual Currency (VC). The Spike Lee Joint" is completely unnecessary
date: but starting in year 2 the game takes a huge leap foward and it becomes a real improvement over last year's encarnation of the mode. I'd recommend skipping every cutscene and just flying through year 1 ASAP. If you want to see the movie later
recommended: it's made available in your second year. It's not awful if you're a fan of Spike Lee
hoursPlayed: it's just way too much if you want to actually play a game. The entire cutscene film is nearly 2 full hours in length. That's ridiculous for a sports game.\n\nAll in all
voteText: a legitimate improvement over 2k15. I've heard online play is a mess

reviewText:
Okay.. I already played NBA 2K since 2K9 for the first time ever I disappointed with 2K Sport

Don't get me wrong, there's some improvement this year. And this is a review based on the pre release date.

Pros :
+ The gameplay animation and physics is good. I like it, feels more real now.
+ More animation for players. More varieties of movements.
+ Dunk feels more powerful
+ Good concept idea on MyCareer (From High School to NBA Draft)
+ AI is harder than last year. AI's Defense is more intense and quite hard to break

Cons :
- Always crashing after half game of the 1st NBA Game of MyCareer. Now I can't continue MyCareer
- Quite lagging compare to NBA2K15 with the same game spec
- MyCareer storyline. You just played as Freq, it doesn't matter what's your name is, you always become Freq. What I enjoy about MyCareer from all the other 2K is I can be myself. Now it doesn't matter, it's Frequency Vibrations who will become the all star. And yes. that's your nickname Frequency Vibrations.
- Some bug where suddenly pass icon just appeared out of nowhere, very annoying especially when I tried to shot and that pass icon suddenly appeared and I end up of passing.
- Stuttering especially on commentator's talk. So lag and they are late to comments any action in court

Of course I will recommended this game if 2K Games is already optimized this game, waiting for some patch and a new GPU driver that support this game. Let's see until the release date, if there's some optimizations and get better, this game is 100% recommended. it's fun

But for this pre release review it's a naaahh
Sorry 2K.. Hope it's got better next week :)

reviewText: A really fun game to play with friends or solo. However, this is probably the 3rd or 4th year in a row that 2k has had release issues with the VC purchases not working at all as well as the pre-order extra VC not being added. The graphics are amazing on the PC and the modes are fun. BUT, it is sad to see 2k fall short and not be 100% ready on launch day. We pre-ordered for a reason and paid for services that have not yet been provided by the mfg... some might call that fraud. I am hoping that 2k will resolve this issue quickly, if not it might be time to go back to NBA live or stock to playing a college title.\n\nMy recommend is yes/no. Just like last year it took them a while to fix most of the issues, right now I would hold off on the game, but if you love basketball I would check the reviews and 2k website in about a month to see if all has been fixed and then get the game.

reviewText: Game is very choppy and laggy. Frame rate issues cause for very frustrating gameplay. Just doesnt seem meant for pc i can run ARK: Survival Evolved on High with less lag than a game of 2k with medium settings and no crowd. I'd request a refund for the game but i put well over 2 hours into just trying to get the game playable by adjusting with the video settings, testing out the game play for a min or two than going back to re adjust.  I put so much time into trying to get this game to work because i actually really enjoy the nba 2k games and have purchased every one since 2k5. Then there are just the issues of getting the pre-order through steam i did not recieve any bonuses even though i bought the Michael Jordan edition and that seems to be a problem that occurs only through steam. Those that bought a physical copy or through amazon have all recieved their pre-order bonuses. I figured id get this game on on my laptop because of  better graphics and frame rates but it doesn't even look or perform as well as 2k14 for my xbox 360. With 12gb of ram and AMD 8700 processor and an AMD radeon r6 8700 graphics card you'd think that wouldnt be the case. If steam and 2k can fix the gameplay issues and the pre-order bonuses missing than game is good but as it stands right now the game is almost unplayable and extremely frustrating and absolutley not worth $99.99, should of just got it for my xbox one id actually be able to shoot the ball without lagging into a travelling violation every so often

reviewText:
If you're looking for an NBA game, you don't really have a choice.
2K kind of exploits that through microtransactions, but it's not near as bad as most games. Sales for VC come up often and are usually pretty decent discounts (ex: 75% $10 amount).

MyCareer sucks. You have hardly any control over your player. The High School and College games are very fun and atmospheric, but they're super short. If you're a white person like me, you get stuck into a black family and can't do anything about it. I wouldn't have an issue with it except for the fact that you have a TWIN SISTER that is also black. The main issue for me outside of the terrible story that you have no influence over is the fact that you can only play EIGHT games your rookie season! And even worse? YOU GO INTO FREE AGENCY AFTER THAT YEAR! I was #1 overall draft pick and I go into FA after the year?

Overall the game is pretty good for gameplay. Jump shooters from midrange are the best, as layups and 3s have a pretty low chance of going in unless the player has high ratings.

MyGM has a nice feature to relocate a team anywhere and completely rebrand it. I chose the Clippers and relocated them to Kansas City after a few years, overall it was a nice experience.

As for online-- I don't play sports games online as they ruin the game for me, but I've heard it's full of cheaters on PC and you'd be better off getting it on a console if you're going to play online.
voteText: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful

reviewText: Updated Review:\nI should have changed to thumbs up for awhile because the updates fixed a lot of the original issues.  I liked this game for about 2 monthes until 2K decided to step in and mess stuff up again.  The MyCareer gameplay seems really awkward with people speeding up and slowing down the game at odd times in order to try and keep the game difficult.  Things like balls magically floating through my player when I jump a lane to steal.  It seems like the game restricts you from being unstoppable, throwing in weird glitches which I have taken pictures to prove.  Players on your team will start moving one way, glitch and move towards his defender, causing turnovers that leave me like, what just happen?".  This gets quite annoying but as you can see
date: I am still a pretty avid user of this game.  It is addictive but honestly I just turn it off in the middle of the game when those weird momentum changes seem to be forced into the gameplay
hoursPlayed: taller cpu teammates getting blocked and characters seemingly molding together
voteText: the player missing steals
helpfulPercent: cpu teammates missing wide open lay-ups.  The list goes on; and it only seems to have gotten worse lately with these updates.\nAlso
votesHelpful: with the new updates I have noticed random crashing.  Once in the playoff's
votesTotal: I have crashed at the end of a game and then had to restart from the beginning when I reloaded myCareer.  I also tried to use the "Save and Quit" option in the menu; only for the game to crash
votesFunny: forcing the game to open a file from a previous save.  If it crashes and no previous save
commentsCount:
quess what?  You're restarting the game.  I just recently lost an entire 3rd Quarter from this crash and it is not the first time.  The crashes seem to have become more frequent as the game has grown older; which is rather odd.

Original Review:
I seriously think 2K Sports are tipping off companies to boost sales and hype up this game.  I don't even know why I paid money for this game.  Mycareer is broken; missing wide open shots all the time with an 85 overall jump shot rating.  Not to mention missing uncontested lay-ups half the the time with 80+ overall rating for inside shooting; those are always great.  I respect Spike Lee but the story is completely wack and nobody cares about behind-the-scene stuff about how you produced this POS game.  Not to mention you can't skip cut scenes in between quarters
column16: forcing you to watch pre-game and post-game videos which takes A LONG TIME TO DO ANYTHING.  After 2K's huge update
column17: my replays stopped working
column18: only showing scenes of the follow-up reactions after the play where your character is talking or whatever.  Who wants to watch that
column19: seriously?  Vsync causes a lot of visual tearing and was the only fix I could come up with for the replay problems.  So now my replays work
column20: but the crowd stutters and everything looks choppy and poorly animated.  I played this game and gave it plenty of times and opportunities to impress me but it's terrible.  Mycareer would be awesome if the gameplay wasn't completely messed up; the calender system and customization aspects are much better than last year.  Yet
column21: I haven't even tried any other aspect of the game besides mycareer because this game frustrated me to the point of no return.  Like I said it's a waste of money.  All the missed shots
column22: choppy framerate

reviewText:
Jacko Rating
9/10
Well another year and another NBA2K - This review assumes you are familiar with the series.
This year the team has given us something a little different and have included a story driven My Career mode, while some will hate it I thought it gave some fresh blood to the franchise and it can be mostly skipped anyway for those who aren't interested.
The game itself has been improved in several areas but to sum up it has become more realistic with the AI playing better and not so many easy dunks or silly looking alley oops in My Park for example.
Graphics and Audio are both top notch and the commentary is an absolute treat with a surprising amount of variation, gameplay has become in my view slightly harder which I luv and My Park has had a few tweaks for the better also, mainly toning  down the massive advantage that taller players had previously and dampened down the 3 point shot success rate in Sunset Park which was very annoying previously and turned the games into rubbish ball for 5 year olds rather than resembeling the real game.
Amazingly the game worked right out of the box - unlike the last 3 years releases which were full of bugs and issues that prevented many gamers from playing the game they bought for several days.
All in all NBA2K is still miles in front of any other BBall sim out there today and this year's release in my view has improved the franchise, given My Park a much needed face lift and brought back the highschool and university ranks to play through in My Career.
A big Thumbs Up on this one :)

reviewText:
The actual gameplay for this game is alright, almost great. So if you just want to shoot some hoops with a friend this is a nice sports game. However, if you care at all about the game delivering on its promises in any actual game mode besides quick matches, you'll be disappointed.

Street - Sure, as long as you don't mind just walking around watching other people playing. You won't actually get to play any games, since as soon as you queue up, everyone else will leave, because they don't want to play with your low ranked scrub. If someone actually takes pity on you, get ready for the bashing of your life, seeing as your skills are probably mid stat and everyone else is maxed out. So time to open your wallet, pay good money and max out your character, wait another 20 minutes to even get into a game, lose anyway since everyone else also bought game potions.

ProAm - I still haven't figured out how this works. As far as I can see it has the same tedious problems as Street - this is just a 5 man version.You character will still suck. And you'll have to wait 30 minutes or so to fill up all slots to get the game going. 2K advertises this as a game mode where you can create your own team where there is an actual ranking, but to my knowledge you won't get anywhere near actually playing as your custom team unless you bring 4 friends.

Career - The Spike Lee joint" part is ridiculous. 2K tries to feed you a storyline and crams in all kinds of characters that are supposed to add immersion. It does just the opposite. I have no idea why my white 5'8 geek was raised in an african-american family in Brooklyn. Nor why he speaks with the deep voice of a 7' giant. I mean
date: I get cut scenes where my stepmom (well
recommended:
you explain it!) explains how she met my stepdad... and this is supposed to immerse me how exactly?
How you perform in high school makes no difference. What college you choose makes no difference. How you perform during your rookie season makes no difference.

Then onto your first real season playthrough. And chances are big you'll finish dead last in your conference. Make a trade

reviewText:
Great game, very different from the past releases.

They have completely remodeled the defense making it a lot harder to just zig zag through the cpu's defense which means you have to really work hard for those shots.

Also passing is different with new controls and animations and with the new defense some passes are you may have used to do are a lot harder leading in several turnovers

They have added a lot more gameplay animations blocks are more realistic, player movements are alot better with faster reaction times. Each player also has their own way of playing. Also body animations are added such as flexing playing with their mouth guard, dunk face animations, gum chewing, etc.

The rating system makes more sense this year even though some of you may disagree they are doing it by comparing the players ability to the greatest in that area like for example the best avg rebounder is Dennis Rodman so he has a 99 OFF and 95 DEF in rebounding compared to a current dominating rebounder with DeAndre Jordan who is given a 92 OFF and 94 DEF and same goes for other attributes so if you dont like it, no one cares.

MyCareer also has the Spike Lee storyline which has lots of mixed feelings. I just want to mention in my opinions stop b*tching just cause yoour family is black, there are countless games that I've played where I'm given a family that looks nothing like me as a created player and like many others we dont complain we just play and enjoy what they give us. Also they'd need more voice actors which would be too expensive for something they're just trying out.
Any way in MyCareer you now have offdays where you get to do either connections (haging out with someone in the leauge such as player, teamowner, celeb) where you get rewards like VC or my favourite you get to pick your game day jersey. Also there's training on off-days for attribute boosts and Endorsments that also give VC. So those are all your choice. Only problem I have with it is you play 3 HS games and 4 College no VC games but are fun and only 8 rookie season games while I would prefer having the whole rookie season to play.

MyGm has been redesigned and is more realistic with team relocation added.

My Team added several new things like player cards that attributes change as the season goes by with their performance.

I may missed some stuff but if this hasn't made you want the game, I don't know what will.

So if you want the best NBA... No, a sports game of all time. Here it is.
Well till 2K releases something better anyway.

reviewText:
Overall, the game is good, the gameplay is solid (if not great) the presentation is nice and there's a lot of stuff you can do.
However, the game still suffers from occasional bugs (no dealbreakers here) and it has certain annoying mechanics which might or might not have been on purpose (i'll come back to that later).

Overall, here are my first impressions, do bear in mind that i do not play nba for the online gameplay (however, Myteam seems fun but Mypark has cheater issues):
- The myGM mode looks solid, there's a lot of stuff you can do and you actually feel like the GM of the team. 10/10.
- As stated before, the gameplay is great, there's a big learning curve if you really want to master the game (a lot of plays and different playbooks in the game,...) and playing a game of basketball is just big fun.

And i'll dedicate a paragraph just for the Mycareer mode, which has it's ups and downs.
First and for all, they practically ♥♥♥♥ed up with the story, it's a bland, boring story filled with stereotypes and YOU ARE NOT THE STORY. You have no saying in the story whatsoever and regardless of how you play the game, the outcome will always be the same and you can't make any important choices. The story doesn't really make sense (seeing as you can be a white guy who has a black twin sister) but that's not a dealbreaker, guess they just didn't think it through.
Also, you can't have any real progression during high school, college and your rookie year, all you can do is follow the story without any of the mycareer (gameplay) mechanics, the real mycareer mode starts AFTER the story is finished, in your second year, but that's not really what alot of us want.

After the story, mycareer is solid and a lot of fun, the gameplay is good, teammates aren't ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ and the rating system is actually fair imo. Player progress doesn't go too fast or too slow and there's a lot of customisation going on, which is always fun.
The game mode is still not without it's annoyances though:
- You can't change the sim quarter length (meaning that the cpu games will always last 48 mins, and if you want to be able to match up to other players/teams statwise you will need to play those minutes as well), i think this is a big miss.
- Another annoyance is the fact that, if you sim your game, you sim the offdays. I for one enjoy organising and thinking on how i'll spend my offdays, be it doing connections, endorsements, or training. I do not intend to play 82 games every season, i like to sim about 30 of them i suppose. Simming these games will also sim your offdays, meaning you can't do anything on these days. Being able to sim day by day would make more sense.

TLDR:
Overall the game is fun, gameplay is great, online has it's flaws, spike lee ♥♥♥♥ed up.

I'd recommend the game to any basketball fan, however, i can't help but feel that 2k could have done a MUCH MUCH MUCH better job.

However since it's 2K, I can for now say it's not worth at the moment; a lot of issues.

reviewText: I have put a fair few hours into this game but I can honestly not recommend it. I will not be purchasing anymore NBA 2k games in the future. As it stands the my career mode is nothing that hasnt been done before and quickly becomes boring. The MyTEAM mode has so much potential but the pack odds for getting good cards are ridculously low and 2k has made it very hard to earn MT in game, so its weighted very heavily towards purchasing ingame currency to win. The majority of people who play Gaunlet on the NZ server just reroll their team until they get a god team, and therefore its almost unplayable if you are trying to play it properly, you just cant compete. Im just disappointed more than anything, 2k does nothing to address any of the issues with the market or the online hacking/cheesing of gaunlet.

reviewText:
This game isn't good, apart from the general gameplay.

Story - 5/10
The story is directed by Spike Lee, and it is - quite frankly - terrible. I don't think it's bad due to the 'ghetto hood rat' type of story, but it is just not good. No character development, and I don't understand where it's going. It almost feels downgraded compared to 2K15.

Gameplay - 8/10
The gameplay is pretty good, and is a lot more fast paced than 2K15. However, the camera is utter ♥♥♥♥ in this interation of the series, and that makes me hate it. Although, you still have basketball at it's core and that's all that matters to some people.

Graphics - 9/10
The graphics are pretty damn amazing. Not lifelike at all, but they feel immersive. That said, getting the game to run without any frame drops is impossible. My GPU is a 660, but I've turned everything to low and even the crowd off and I get around the same frames as I do with everything on ~high.

Multiplayer - 0/10
Have fun trying to get this to work. I spent 3 HOURS TRYING TO GET THIS TO WORK. But steam still has the audacity to tell me that I've played to much, even though I tried to refund it on the day I bought it. I've sent them around 10 refund requests, but to no avail. Steam obviously don't care about their customers, or they would have realised that this game is broken in a lot of places and therefore I have a vaild reason to get a refund. Don't bother buying this for co-op/multiplayer.

Overall - 5/10. Don't buy it. Do yourself a favour. Waste of money and steam won't even let me refund it. I hope they realise that they are being ridiculous. If you just want to play MyCareer, make sure to grab a GTX 970/R9 390 so you have the best experience. The camera pan frame drops are stupid.
