reviewText:
So after more than 172 hours into this game, and undoubtedly more to come, I think I can give a good Review on this game. I play on Superstar difficulty. You should bear that in mind when I review gameplay mechanics.

GRAHICS: 8/10 It's more centered towards consoles, of course. It's still good. My mom once passed me playing & asked Are you watching March of Madness?" Should give you an idea.

GAMEPLAY: 9/10 The most important part of a basketball game is
recommended: the basketball. & no one should be disappointed in this aspect. Even though this game is obviously more geared towards console users
hoursPlayed: the game is still miles better than previous titles in punishing the user for not having basketball simple IQ. You're going to hear a lot of people say that 2k15 was better. & I'll be honest it's easier to beast mode on Hall of Fame. But that's simply because you can cheese too much. Why I rate This game so high is because of its attempt to limit cheesing from previous titles & keep/improve upon the incorperation of real basketball concepts.\n\nShot Selection Importants:  Early after the games release you had players like Steph Curry missing 3 pointers taken early in transition
voteText: & unexplicably you still have players now with high 3 point accuracy missing open shots sometimes. The updates have fixed this a little
helpfulPercent: but I like where their heads where at. Because even though we have amazing 3 point shooters in the league
votesHelpful: being a championship team is not about taking good shots
votesTotal:
but passing up good shots for great ones. & more importantly the rhythm you're in when you take your shot is hugely important. The game will punish you if you aren't smart with the ball.

Knowing when a player is on a hot night & when he's cold is hugely important. & It mostly depends on his physical state & morale. If your player in MyCarrer has been on the practice court after back to back games & tomorrow he's got another match you can bet he's going to be tired as balls & miss a lot of his easy shots. If you're unfamiliar with 2k they still do a great job of programming the AI to play like the real team would. You can bet that the Clippers are going to punish you with a ally-oop if you leave a lane open. Golden State will punish you from 3 if you're not physical on Defense.

Speaking of Defense this is where I have to commend this game. In 2k15 the defense was too easy to press the boost trigger & run around defenders. You could just cut & boost around the Defense going to the hole way to easily. In this title you have to EARN ALL YOUR POINTS. You have to know how to break ancles
votesFunny: having the wallet to increase your stats aren't enough. You actually have to know how to play the game of basketball. When to create isolation shots for you & your teamates
commentsCount: how to do that on and off the ball
column16: etc. This game has vastly improved the Defense. They won't let you get past them by just hitting the boost button.\n\nMYCAREER 7/10: Let's address what's on everyones mind: Spike Lee Joint. Now I'm going to say it up front. This title has made me make a new rule about anything I play. "If at any point the story brings you to tears
column17: you cannot rate it below 7/10. No matter how many hours the story is." I don't want to spoil anything folks
column18: but there's a reason this game has the Story Rich tag. Spike Lee once again releases a controversal story which
column19: in my opinion
column20: tries to show you the life of what it's ACTUALLY like for most NBA players. It's not all shoe deals & fame but you still have a past. You still have friends from your past. The most important element of NBA life I think this story potrays is you will have friends & family leach off of your & it's how you respond to your situation that determines your success in the NBA. The positives of this story far outweigh the negatives
column21: in my opinion. Then again I care more about basketball than the story.\n\nNow we stll have to talk about the negatives. Your family is inevitably black. No matter how you swing it. This normally wouldn't be a problem for someone if you aren't racist
column22: cause adoption
column23: but the story makes reference about your sister being a biological twin. So it kind of ruins the immersion if your character isn't black. Which is why I think this title is different because it's not supposed to be you
column24: but Freq. Why people are mad at this is because in times past you were able to be yourself & there would be relatively no story but you would sign shoe deals & be a megastar. I've tried to find a million different ways to say this but this game doesn't necessarily want your face on the story
column25: but instead Freq's. It's the difference between role-playing a defined character or a silent protagonist in my opinion. A preference thing. reviewText:
First sports game I bought day one since Madden 11 for the 360. Last sports game I buy day one until Madden or some sort of REAL football comes to PC. IDK how many hours I have put into 2k as a game company (not just b-ball) but it's a lot I will spare you the details, sufficed to say I feel they could do better.

Step 1. Go to ♥♥♥ .com and purchase the game for much cheaper than retial...
Step 2. Regret purchase and uninstall
Step 3. Write this review detailing the steps I took to get here

Seriously though, the game is fun to an extent. Someone else said after the first myplayer, it's a grind well I say it is ALL A GRIND. The VC is more scarce and harder to get. They added more VC accomplishments but than they don't unlock. My character gets stuck in weird animations all the time. I can't skip cutscenes. IDK how many times I pressed start to skip a scene only to have it accidently take me to the park...

The park... Dear God the park

So the top guy shown on the loading screen is obviously a cheater. So is the second, thrid and fourth on down the line all 99 across the board. Some ppl are 7 ft tall and have the speed of I.T. (Boston Celtics P.G. now) and the quicks of A.I. mixed with the passing of J-will and Nash combined with the strength of Shaq in H.S. and Ben Wallace in his prime. Put all that mixed with the hops of that one nukka who pulled the 720 dunk on And One back in like '04 and you have a bunch of ultimate players that hardly pass the ball but know how to Kobe it up.

You ever see that meme on FB where Kobe is sitting at the table and someone asks him to PASS the salt and he has that perplexed look like WTF nukka pass?" That's EVERYONE in the park from day one because they are all the greatest players in a TEAM sport. 2v2 is a joke. 3v3 is fun but only until the mascot comes around skateboarding with Allen Iverson next to him. Or the topless CHICK. To be clear
date:
you CANNOT be a Female character in this game UNLESS you cheat.

They supposedly fixed the fact that noone could join anyone else's homecourt ever. My court was pretty cool looking. They did add some nice features but again it's a pain. The controls are different this year again... The story is just plain not needed. The always online mycareer is stupid and has been since day one. The reason I play mycareer is to play BY MYSELF in MY CAREER. I don't want it to be online if I did I would play it in online mode. That's why Madden has franchis online and offline OPTIONS. Madden doesn't force me to play my game online if I don't want to.

All that to say this: I got banned a while back for apprently exploiting the same thing that A LOT of ppl did and that's fine the servers will be off in a year or so anyways. NBD. My issue is that there was NO WARNING. That's all I will say on that.

I do reccomend this game especially right this moment as it's just 20 dollars. I do not recommend this game if you want to play my career

reviewText:
NBA 2K16 by far has the best gameplay of any basketball game to date.
There are so many game modes that'll get you engaged to this game such as MyPark, MyCareer, My League, My Team, MyGM, Online Leagues, etc.

The gameplay has been improved compared to last year.
It has the best AI (Artificial Intelligence) of any basketball game.

Many people complain about Spike Lee's Livin Da Dream" on My Career.
but here's my thoughts on it...

To be honest
date:
I find "Livin Da Dream" to be ok if and only if you view it as a standalone movie.
It's ok if you're just viewing it as the life of Frequency Vibrations.

But the bad part about it is that you have no choice but to step into the shoes of Frequency Vibrations. Whoever player you create becomes Frequency Vibrations. It just didn't feel like the player I wanted to be. I mean I don't decide on stuff like he do. It just didn't feel like me.

Maybe the advertising of "Be The Story" mislead some people on My Career.
Maybe they should've advertised it as "Be The Story of Freq" or "Step into the shoes of Freq..." or something like that so that fans of My Career should not have been mislead to thinking of actually being the story or having to choose what story your player will have on the journey to the NBA. Instead
recommended: they gave us a fixed background story of your journey to the NBA.\n\nBut Overall
hoursPlayed: MyCareer along with the whole game of NBA 2K16 is pretty good.\nThis is a must buy for all of the basketball lovers who plays Bball on consoles

reviewText:
Being a regular customer for NBA 2K games since it first came on PC with 2K9, I didn't really expect much from this game - I came in thinking that this was pretty much 2K15 but with the current roster. While that is true for the most part, there have been more improvements than I expected, particularly with the gameplay itself.

Smoother animations, better dunk animations, better rebounding, and a better-than-expected MyCareer mode are some of the things I definitely like so far.

However, it does not have the best optimisation for PC - while mine runs just fine (i5-6600K, R9 390, 8gb RAM, 1440p) but a lot of people are having trouble with framerate drops and poor performance overall. The controls have been changed yet again, which would take some getting used to (though it does feel better than with 2K15).

Overall, I am quite satisfied with this iteration of the series, but it's definitely not for everyone. There's still a lot more to improve in this game, but with yearly releases, I can't really complain too much.
voteText: 6 of 13 people (46%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Let me make this clear. I love the changes to MyGM and MyLeague, which is the only reason I'm recommending this game. However, if you are intending to make MyCareer the majority of your playing experience...DO NOT BUY THIS GAME. The game is advertised as 'My Story' yet puts you on a linear preplanned story. If it was my story my guy would not have been born in Harlem, he would have attended a different college program, and he would have stayed for more than one year. Spike Lee directing the story ruins whatever immersion I had with the character.

I feel MyCareer has some good moments and ideas. I love the idea of playing high school ball and choosing a college. Yeah there are only 9 choices and I wish there were more, but I understand why with the cost of getting more on board so I don't let that bother me.

What MyCareer did wrong. Only able to spend one year in college; I get it you are supposed to be a superstar but let us decide if we want to stay one more year. Heck make the games challenging enough that we don't win the NCAA tournament giving us the option to stay and try again out of pride. Your skill rating when you join the NBA is a puny 55. This forces you to either play with a crappy player, buy VC with your money, or farm in other modes first. On top of that they kept the grouped together stat increases that NBA 2k15 started, which reduces the variation of play styles I could develop MY player into.

I haven't finished up to the FA period yet, so I can't comment on length of seasons fairly. I do like shorter seasons compared to the older games when you had to play every game, but I don't like them moving away from 2k15's decision to let you pick which games you play.

Overall, if you are looking at this game for the MyPlayer mode...just stick to 2k15 or 2k14 and just watch the cutscenes on YouTube. If you are looking at the MyGM/MyLeague then I say buy it, the improvements are worth it.
voteText: 6 of 13 people (46%) found this review helpful 1 person found this review funny

reviewText:
2K16 is a huge improvement to 2K15. With that said, a lot of negative reviews here are from the fps/stutter issues and terrible keyboard support. On default video settings, I also experienced fps drops and stutters during gameplay with a 980 and i7 4790k. However, after switching from Fullscreen mode to Windowed Fullscreen in the video options, all my fps and stutter issues were gone. I'd suggest a lot of people to try that if they are having problems and avoid using a keyboard for now. As far as crashes go, I haven't experienced any at all.

Pros:
-Improved MyCareer
-Improved MyGM and MyLeague
-Improved gameplay over 2K15
-Incredible depth in MyLeague
-Animations are way better
-Defense is actually challenging and rewarding
-Very smooth gameplay after stutters were fixed


Cons:
-Bug with Fullscreen mode plagued with fps and stutter issues
-Bad keyboard support


I'd highly recommend this if you are a fan of 2K15, as 2K16 is a massive improvement over it.

reviewText:
Game is great - I dont know what you're talking about.  You go through most of the negative reviews and they center on one of the following:

1)  The Mycareer mode isnt great - which is subjective.

You shouldnt thumbs down an entire game on a mode that lasts only 8 or so games.  Once you get out of the Spike Lee Joint it goes back to what you know and love back in 2k15 for example.

2)  The game has tech problems / my computer is too butthurt to run this game.

This is again subjective.  I honestly dont have a great system, R9 270x, 16gb of ram (game with Dell rig) and a I7 3.60 gig processor among other things.  Bottom line if you dont have those specs dont play this game - if you ran 2k15 fine, you'll be more than fine with this one.

3)  The game doesnt support keyboard controls or the keyboard controls are poop.

Are you serious?  This is not only 2015 but a sports game, a console game, a game that I would figure is PHYSICALLY IMPOSSIBLE to play without an analogue controller.  Its like trying to play a flightsim without a joystick, or even at least a controller.  There are certain genres that suit certain control methods and keyboard isnt one for sports games - or anything that operate in a 3D playing field.  Back in the day when you only moved left and right or up and down sure, but again this is 2015.

So again overage this game is top notch, I played 2k15 to death at almost 70 hours and I got it when the season was almost over.  I got the game now before the start of the season and I am already almost at 18 hours.

Only valid complaint i would say is that its not newbie friendly, the computer AI will CRUSH you if you dont know how to basketball and it doesnt do a good enough job of teaching" you how to play or why you should do certain things.  So brush up on your basketball IQ before hand or be ready to lose a lot of games.

WELL WORTH THE PURCHASE 5/5"

reviewText:
If you're a true fan of the series then you will have fun with this no doubt.

PROS:
+ The gameplay is much more improved then previous titles and plays remarkably smooth.

+ Player customization has improved slightly with the addition of more hairstyles and a better tattoo system.
(Light skin players still look like cavemen)

+ Graphics are on point as always, 2K does not disappoint in this aspect.
(With the addition of SweetFX it can enhance your experience)

+ Modes like MyGM and MyLeauge have been improved.  The off-season is one of my favorite parts.  Also you can relocate as many teams as you want in MyLeauge.  Since there are no college mods yet I decided to base each team off NCAA teams to add my own twist.

+ Roster customization.

+ Uniform and court customization is a plus.

+ Soundtrack is good, not the best, but good compared to previous titles.

+ Runs smooth at a steady 60FPS on all high settings with the addition of SweetFX.
(Tested on an i5 4690k, R9 280)

CONS:
- Little care to the PC online community from the devs.

- Lots of cheaters, horrible matchmaking, and MyPARK is still a joke.  You can't even communicate with other players, there is no mic support online...what the ♥♥♥♥ 2K?

- MyCareer... I was so hyped for this mode but Spike Lee's involvement puts so many limitations on what the MyCareer should of really been, at least for your high scool, college, and rookie season... It was rushed and felt like I had no control over my player's decisions other then selecting which college I wanted to play for.  Anyways after your rookie season is over the actual mode is unlocked and just like the previous year it's the same with some slightly new additions.  This mode honestly gets boring after a while, 2K does very little in terms of detail and doing something during your off-season.

reviewText:
I think this is the only NBA 2k that is actually superior in nearly every way than its predecessors.  It's more fluid, it has better graphics, it has more customization, it has more everything.  Some new features are executed very well and really add something new to the game.  It feels like a better game from day 1.  I've been interested enough to play 17 hours in 3 days, and more importantly, I've had new things to do in 17 hours.  All the negative reviews are filled with people with more hours than me, like, come on.

But... the negative reviews are pretty justifiable.  2k has somehow forgotten the preorder bonuses and have done nothing about the hackers.  Every myPark game you go to, you will find a hacker.  Hacks include:
-99 overall hack
-Park cards hack
-Badges hack
-Skin hack
-Bodymod hack
And it also doesn't help that the PC version is terribly optimised and the myCareer seems like some half ♥♥♥♥♥ third party movie.  There is absolutely no freedom of choice in the myCareer.  It's completely possible they'll add a patch upgrading the story, fixing the optomisation, but at this stage of the game, don't get your hopes up.  I'm not really playing myCareer right now because they will presumably wipe your progress.

Yes, you should buy this game if you're an avid basketball fan.  Even if this game sucked, I'd still buy it.  And dont think live 16 is that much better than 2k16.  So yeah, but it I guess.

reviewText:
First I will start off with saying I'm not a HUGE NBA fan. I've played 2k15 and some of the older NBA live games over the years. I bought 2k16 because I wanted an updated version of 2k15.

Overall it seems like people want to complain about the MyCareer mode. I don't understand what everyones complaints are. Yea it is a little odd I made a white guy with a black twin sister. But I found it more funny haha than annoying. In fact, I found 2k15 to be worse since it was almost impossible to make a white guy that didn't have black features and to top it all off they forced your voice to be black as well. So in reality why didn't people complain about that in 2k15? Cause it didn't matter, just like this doesn't matter.

Ignore the peopel who think the MyCareer mode is only about this story. The story is actually a very SHORT part of MyCareer mode. It only last around 15 games. You do Highschoo, then College, then your Rookie year. After that, it doesn't matter where you got drafted, where you went to school, or what your nickname is. You can change ALL of those settings after the rookie year. Think of the story as a cool intro to the mode and also 15 games to learn the controls without having any negative impact on your character. It doesn't matter how bad you play at all in those games, you will get the same result.

As for the game overall I give it a 8/10. It does basketball well. The passing is improved from last year. I don't have my guy dropping passes into the other teams middle when trying to pass behind me. The control stick seems more responsive on changes to dunks and layups. The graphics are hot. I play on everything maxed, with 100fps all the time, and can see the sweat coming off the guys perfectly. Best of all, I can use my DS4 controller, without DS4tools, and keep the xbox icons. Last year, it defaulted to 1,2,3,4 buttons instead of the icons, making it hard to know which button was what.

If you liked 2k15, get this. It's improved and fun. Even the review sites are giving it a 7 or 8. The only people complaining are those who can't get over the intro to the story mode.

reviewText:
The graphics are definitely an upgrade from 2k15. From shooting to general movement, the game feels really smooth. I haven't experienced any crashes yet. I am running this on 1440p with a GTX 980.

My only quirk is that MyCareer has a little too much story. I like that fact that I can play in high school and all of that, but sometimes the cut scenes are way too long and not engaging at all. It all goes away after the first season though,, but then it feels completely empty because there are rarely anymore cut scenes.

Also MyPark is basically dead during the day, but is packed during the night time. I do see a lot of the same people around so I hope the online community stays alive, but I wouldn't be surprised if everyone stops playing. I would say that the console ports have a bigger and wider community. I would blame it on the PC optimization of this game.

Great game overall. Judging by the other reviews I wouldn't get this game unless you have a decent graphics card. If you can run this game you will have a lot of fun.

It's pretty sickening to see people bash a game that is THIS good.  This may be the best sports game ever made!  Don't get me wrong, it has some problems; namely connectivity issues that I'm confident will be fixed and yes the Career mode is kinda dumb at times, but overall even it is better than ever.

Every mode in this game is better than ever before.

Basketball has never been portrayed with more accuracy, fluidity, and detail than it is in this version of NBA 2k.  If you liked 2k15 but thought it still didn't feel quite like what you see on tv, well you're in for a true treat.

This is B-Ball for fans of B-Ball.

reviewText:
Perspective: I'm a fan of the NBA 2K series for some time now, I have played every single game since 2K11 extensively and I have played NBA 2K16 for close to 150 hours at the time of this review.

Short and sweet:
NBA 2K16 is the best sports simulation game I have played to date. Unlike franchises like FIFA and Pro Evolution Soccer, 2K constantly reinvents it's game on a yearly basis rather than release the same product just with updated rosters every year.
This year's title is a big step forward from the last one and it manages to do a lot of things right, particularly now after a few patches.
If you're a basketball fan or even if you're just looking for a fun sports game to play casually, I would fully recommend you pick up this game even at full price.

Long and nitpicky:
The game's launch was not without it's issues, from gameplay tweaks that were made through patches and performance issues on PC... It was not a complete disaster but far from a perfect launch, from the inability for keyboard users to edit keybinds to graphic settings rendering the game unplayable it took some doing to get a great experience out of it at launch. As of the time of this review, most of these issues have been addressed though a little history never hurts anyone looking to make an informed purchase.

Positives:
The game boasts fairly good visuals and don't even get me started on the gameplay... It is by far the best basketball simulation game I have ever played, actually make that the best sports simulation game!

Relatively low requirements on the hardware front make it accessible to a wide range of consumers which is always good though I'd recommend at least meeting the recommended requirements for a complete visual experience.
For comparison's sake, I run the game on a GTX 970 (non-OC) and an i5 4690k (OC to 4,2 Ghz) with every possible filter injected (8x Supersample + 8x MFAA + FXAA) via Nvidia control panel and it runs silky smooth at 60 FPS at a 1080p resolution without GPU usage ever going above around 80% so we're dealing with a decent port here.

When it comes to gameplay, most of the cheese tactics from previous years have been nullified in this year's game. Want to drive baseline and get a bucket everytime? Better boot up 2K15 then because it's not happening in 2K16.
Excellent AI defense makes it a challenge to score every trip down the floor, mindless attempts to get to the basket will most likely result in blocked shots than in points, attempting to thread the needle through defenders will probably end up in a turnover... These are but a few examples of how AI has been improved this year.

Most game modes are back and better than before, such as myGM and myTEAM. Up-to-date rosters, new and better animations and all other goodies that one might expect are also a part of the package.


Negatives:
The myCAREER mode was highly hyped as a Spike Lee directed story and I'm afraid it was arguably this game's greatest letdown. You follow your player's career since high school, into college and eventually into the NBA although in some key points along the ride you're faced with decisions which are presented to you but you really have no deciding power over what happens next. You're only able to play 8 games during your rookie year in the league (9 if your team makes the playoffs) the rest will be automatically simulated. This game mode opens up once you reach your sophomore year in the league however and from there the experience is excellent.

The typical flavor of the month builds for myPLAYERs still exist after every patch, if you're looking to play myPARK or other online modes extensively this information might be of value to you.
Also there are some latency issues for non-NA players, I personally can't make a jumper online because of this.

myTEAM mode gets content updates regularly, but not regularly enough and most of the content it gets is irrelevant. This mode along with myPARK are the modes I'd classify as the 2 main attractions of the game when it comes to online play so I definitely see this as a negative. Most new packs contain only 1 or 2 relevant new cards and the rest will literally never see the light of day and have no use aside from contributing towards collection rewards.


Summing up:
NBA 2K16 is a solid 9/10 if I was asked to resort to that rating system.
It's not a perfect game, but the issues it has have not dragged down the experience for me. The revamped gameplay and gorgeous visuals keep me coming back for more.
The game is well worth it's full price and a complete must-have for any basketball simulation fan.

reviewText:
This will be the last NBA game from 2k for me for a while. Though the gameplay is fun most of the time, the has bugs and glitches which carry on from year to year.

Savefiles can get corrupted and become unloadable. Which means your spent VC are lost! This can happen to MyCareer and to MyGM (ever bought the team for 50k VC and some seasons later you can't load the save anymore? Very nice...)
The game is balanced too much around the VC and onlinegameplay. Because of issues with MyPark during the last years, where 7 footers could hit 3s and run as quick as small point guard, they changed the skill system (again! and again for the worse). No my center is lame as a duck and can never be as quick as f.e. Dwight Howard. And you can't be the new Nowitzki or Jordan because the harsh way your skills are bound to your height is ridicoulus. I don't like the upgrading of skills in fixed categories either. Want to raise your midrange game? Well, then you have to raise 3s, fts as well. The old system, where you could just raise the one skill you wanted is gone since last year.

Ingame the AI is often stuck and players will just hold on to the ball and do nothing until the shotclock is down to 2, then they will shoot a contested fadeaway 3...

The new MyCareer story is a nice idea but failed hard. The story is outright racist, because there is just one family option. Want to be a white guy, or asian, or indian? Well, see how your twin and the whole family are afroamericans. They could have easily changed the story to say you have been adopted as a child and it would be fine! Then the story is always the same, just the teams you play for change. In your rookie season, you can play only 8 games and have absolutely no clue what's going on in the nba because you can't see any rankings, stats, etc. Becoming ROY is almost impossible, because you won't be getting the minutes you need and the other rookies are starters and play very good. Even with 15ppg 10rpg  and 2bpg I wasn't ROY, because i only played 20min/pg.You can't use custom rosters on MyCareer too btw, so no editing the playes too their real values. You won't earn any VC during highschool or college and will start as a 55 overall in the nba, even if you manage to get picked top ten or even #1. Well, 2k wants you to buy VC ;-)
Then your second season, after free agency(!) you can earn 17million $ a year and still come off the bench. That you go to free agency after season 1 is total ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t and breaks the nba rules. You are no second rounder, come on 2k!

Buy this only for 10€ or under in a sale.

reviewText:
Here is my thoughts on the game as of two main gamemodes as in the MyGM gamemode and the MyCareer Gamemode


MyGM:

I felt like the MyGM mode was fairly good and very refreshing for a gamemode that has been the same and kind of needed a new thing added to it. The team relocation is a great addition, but is very hard to do and you need to play for a long time to get enough salary to even have the oppurtunity to do the relocation. So if you have the time to do 4-5 seasons and be able to complete the goals then you will be fine. But if you only do anything below the 4-5 seasons then the MyGM mode is mainly the same with only a new layout and 3-team trades to go along with it.

MyCareer:

They add highschool, college, and you get a story through the first year in the NBA. What could go wrong? That you play 15 games, 3 being 3 minute quarters, and then watch a movie for the rest of the time having no control when if it is really your life and options then you should be able to choose like you could in NBA 2K15. But this is really sad to see because they advertise it as a game where you can choose your story and life.......in reality you can't.

NBA 2K15 - 7/10

Get it on sale, not for full price.

reviewText:
The best basketball game out there. 8/10

But first, I'll start with the cons. 1. The fact that I had to waste 2 days trying to get hold of a Xbox controller is frankly ridiculous as the keyboard controls in 2K16 are ♥♥♥♥. 2. Some glitches like commentary cutting out completely for like 10 minutes during each game are annoying. 3. I couldn't play on the Park without getting destroyed until I was at least 80 OVR. Cashers....

However, 2K16 is still a very good game. Gameplay improved, new features on GM/League/Team are refreshing and fun. MyCareer is still the most indepth career mode in any sports game. But my biggest beef with the MyCareer is the rookie season, which Spike Lee seems to think is unimportant to us.

reviewText:
Best NBA 2K game so far, concerning gameplay and visuals. It's more or less the same game as the before years, without some of the kinks and with a couple additional features.
It's really, really, really fun! I mostly played MyPlayer (the career mode) with two positions (PG and C) and this year it's better than ever, because the AI actually tries to set up plays and moves around the whole shotclock, whereas before they just stood around when the play fell apart.
I didn't like the newest, most hyped, addition to the game which was Spike Lee's Story Mode in MyPlayer. Yeah it's fun to play in high school and college but it just sucks that you only play about 10 games your rookie year and the rest is simulated. Part of the fun for me was trying to win ROY award and play in All Star Games while my stats aren't that good. Another weird thing is (and I skiped most of the story) that you're released at the end of your first year, and sign a 10 million dollar contract in your 2nd year in the league, with pretty much any team you like.

Long story short: Buy it, you won't be disappointed (even in MyPlayer once you finish the Spike Lee storyline)

reviewText:
Running it with an fx-8350 and an R9 380 at max settings, haven't had any frame rate drops at all, the audio has moments during games where it seems like it's been put through a bitcrusher, but it usually doesn't last for more than a second or two so it's not a big negative.

Pros:
Gameplay is extremely fluid, no more running past clunky defenders, earn your baskets.
When you score, you actually feel good about yourself.
Post play has been improved greatly, animations are smoother and believable.
Animations in general have been greatly improved.
As someone who generally dislikes most of the musical tracks in the NBA games, I don't find myself wanting to mute it anytime the music starts playing, so I guess that's a plus.
The be a coach mode or whatever has also received an overhaul and is very deep in terms of choices and gameplay.
Stadiums look really really nice
The rim moves when you dunk... Sometimes.
Your MYPlayer actually looks like he could be based off of a real person and not some ♥♥♥♥ed up generic clone.


Cons:
The story in MYCareer mode is VERY CHEESY, not enough for me to dislike the game, but enough to be mentioned as a con.
Though animations have been improved, there are a couple contact-shot animations near the basket that could use some work.
Haven't received my bonus VC yet for the pre-order, I heard that I'll be able to get it when the game officially releases on the 29th. How come the console peasants get their Bonus now??? Yes, I'm salty.



OVERALL- The game has improved substantially over the last few years, both in terms of animations and graphical detail. I'll give it a 9/10 and definitely would reccomend it to those of you who haven't yet pulled the trigger on it.

reviewText:
Lovely game, feels a little unoptimized for modern machines - I've been running Mad Max at ultra high resolutions, but this game is giving my video card much more of a workout.

Still.

Very recognizably a Spike Lee production, MyPlayer is actually engaging this year. New pass controls are pretty slick, and the soundtrack is - as always - on point.

If you like the 2K games, buy it. If you think you might like a basketball game, it's a great way to find out. If you want a single-player Basketball sojourn from Harlem to the NBA, with RPG advancement mechanics, thoughtful, nuanced acting, and a lot of people yelling, as curated by Spike Lee, there really aren't any other options.

I for one, didn't know I wanted this until I got it.

reviewText:
NBA 2K16 boasts the most impressive feature set of any sports game I've ever played. I normally despise basketball, but this game has started my transformation back into a fan.

+One you're through the Spike Lee part of MyCareer, the mode is fantastic and holds a lot of depth.
+MyLeague is a customizer's dream! You can move any team, re-brand them, control every team, or just let the CPU run a league in the background.
+MyGM is the ultimate manager game inside a full sim basketball game. Building relationships a lot of fun. Al Horford has massive paranoia that I'm going to trade him. It's like I'm telling my girlfriend I'm totally not cheating on her every 5 minutes.
+Best looking sports game out there.
+Best presentation of any sports game out there.

-There are some technical issues, like commentary cutting out, graphical glitches, and some of the online modes aren't fully up to par, but for a single player like me, these are small issues that will hopefully be fixed.
-Spike Lee's story is underwhelming.

reviewText:
Such a shame,What a pitty aswell.
Nba2k16 was building to be the best basketball game ever and dont get me wrong it's ALOT fun to play but it has some serious issues that need addressing

The bad:
- Computer wins 90% tip off
- Shorts are buggy
- Camera gets stuck in audience after half time for long periods of time
- Invisible players
- long time out's that cant be skiped and you are made to wait 20+ seconds
- Replay camera doesnt show the replay
- In the actual replay menu the camera is hella buggy
- Long match up screens getting stuck
- Mypark is hella laggy most of the time
- Day one bug that has destroyed the community ( Free 200,000 vc ) <- since been removed from players who cheated
- Cheaters in mypark,All badages, overall 99, All the perks of being a legend 5 at rookie level, Can lag servers, Crash games, Quit and win, Probably more.
- Other modes have cheaters aswell.

Now that you have read the bad here are some of the good,

The good:
- Update engine so that players move better
- Mycareer mode is fun with the little story that it has
- Mypark is fun without cheaters
- New mycourt that you can customise and show off your trophies
- New pregame commentary while the game loads

- Diffrent game modes

I would highly recommend you get this game IF you dont play it online. If you want to play it online very quickly learn who the cheaters are and NEVER play them, boycot them. If they want to play walk off the court.

reviewText:
As of now I do not recommend this game.

Okay how do I start this review about this horrendous game. This is by-far the worst launch I have ever saw. I buy the MJ Edition (Preordered) and I don't get any bonuses. Can't buy VC so I can look at the court items, clothing, etc. Well  I guess It wouldn't matter anyways since the servers are so damn bad that it won't even let me go to the store! Thats not all. First 2.5 hours were great. No lag or anything on my I7 4790k, gtx980 4.00GB... But I decided to restart my PC to check if it was my internet keeping me from looking at the store items. When I started the game after restart; it lagged like crazy. I couldn't move in the menu... took 10+ seconds to move down each mode. I tried many fixes; validating files, patching, downloading drivers, etc. Now I am going to reinstall the damn game... The story is good so far; I like the addition. The gameplay was fun, but now I can't do anything...

Please please please don't buy this till you know for sure that there is a patch. I am keeping you from losing you sanity...

I will edit this when a patch comes out, and I know the game doesn't really launch till the 29th.

reviewText: I have mixed feelings about this game. MyCareer, at least the story portion of it is awesome at first. You go from high school, to college to the NBA, after that it's one giant cluster of a mess of a story. I didn't really like it one bit. You get two choices in the story 1) What high school you're attending and 2) What college you're committing to. It was difficult to get immersed into a story that I didn't particularly care about and the story wasn't engaging at all, there is no input, no matter how poorly you play your rookie season, the story arc is exactly the same. Spike Lee? Please stay away from video games, your story telling is sub par.\n\nOther than that, the game itself is really good. The controls feel different and I think it's a good thing. The mechanics feel better and you can see the work they put in on the animations in the game. I like how deep the customization is on relocation from the arena, to uniforms, to logos..ect, it's all on point.

reviewText:
Although far from being perfect, 2k16 is the best basketball sim out right now. It improved a lot gamplay-wise, but took a step back in production quality. Upated Nvidia drivers and future patches will def be needed. As of right now, it's a:

7/10

+ Defense actually matters now. It's very difficult to 1v5 anymore. A lot of people will complain about this, but once you learn how to call plays and use picks, it's not bad.
+ Improved passing mechanics
+ More things to do in MyCareer. Also I actually liked the story that Spike did during the rookie year. It's a lot different from last year, and if it's not your thing, it's easy to skip.
+ Better rating system imo
+ More historic teams
+ Much better music than last year

- Can't change PC controls
- High school/college gameplay in MyCareer is very shallow and doesn't give you any VC
- Crashes. The game crashes much more often, and it's very frustrating.
- Buggy. There are times during the game when it just 'hangs up' during the cutscenes, and i'm stuck looking at some guy for like 20s before anything happens. The announcers randomly stop talking at times too.
- Performance. I actually haven't noticed that big of a performance difference btwn 2k15 and 16, but a lot of other ppl apparently have. Just wait for updated video drivers guys!
- Hackers online already

reviewText:
NBA2k16 has been poorly ported to the PC. It suffers frequent crashes, unacceptably long loading times, and in general the story doesn't add anything to the game. I was a fan of NBA2k15 and NBA2k13 but with 10 hours on the clock I'm already ready to stop playing NBA2k16.

I feel that the gameplay is a solid improvement over NBA2k15 but it's held back by everything not related to actually playing basketball. I like the fact 2k was willing to try something new in my career but the implementation leaves me feeling like I'm playing some arcade game. Finally, this game is once again attempting to sell you a virtual currency as a method of making yet more money. On a game that can cost as much as $80 it's unacceptable.

Final note on the virtual currency - It's possible to use Cheat Engine to increase how much virtual currency you have. Do not spend money on the microtransactions just hack in 100k virtual currency through a cheat table. Just search for cheat engine table nba2k16" on your favorite search engine."

reviewText:
This game is an excellent basketball game, the problem is that this year MyCareer isn't your career plain and simple. Yes it can be argued that it was never your career anyway, since this is just a video game and you create a player and all, but at least it felt as it was.

You play as somone else vision of a player and you try to put yourself in the mix. I don't dislike the story I even think it's a pretty well put story, but there is little room left for imagination in the way you are introduced to the NBA and get your rookie year behind you.

For the second time in a row in MyCareer, you don't really play a real current NBA season (in MyCareer let's be clear) the season is just a blur, and even if it goes well with the story (the other person story, clearly not mine) it left a bad taste, no rookie of the year, not even stats... the game really start at the end of your rookie season, and is improved compared to last year from this point onward.

For this reason I might be tempted to not recommend this game if all you wanted to play was MyCareer, but again, from season 2 onward, the mycareer, is better than it was before, that if of course, you can deal with being called FREQ...

You can anyway play an alternate MyCareer by editing a player and putting it in a roster (Myleague or MyGm) and playing only this player by chosing it's position.

Despite this mixed feeling the start of Mycareer mode, I will recommend this game for the whole package.

reviewText: I love the 2K series. Been playing these games for a long time. The graphics of this game are bananas! So good. My favorite part of these games is usually the MyCareer mode. Not the case with 2K16. This is a Spike Lee joint in the truest form. You're a black kid from Harlem, even if your player is white. You and your family grow up in the projects. I mean, OK. But then when you get drafted your team owner is apparently a rich white racist who makes fun of the way black poeple talk. Completely unnecessary. That's Spike for you though. Other than that, your player seems to forget how to shoot/walk once they get into the league and you start off as a 55 so the first few games are really enjoyable (sarcasm). Kyrie had my point guard on skates the whole game. I've been called for traveling on about half of my jump shots-which is due to the lag. I've played around with video settings and my nvidia control panel but we're just going to have to wait for a patch to fix the lag I believe. I'm not going to complain too much about the lag because it should be an easy fix and the game will be very good I think once everything is patched up. It will be worth the money, ya know, when it's playable.

reviewText:
I love sports games and had been looking forward to playing the Spike Lee story of Frequency Vibrations" for some time although basketball isn't my sport (September is normally saved for Fifa or Madden).

Initially I didn't recommend the game with early pre-release issues with lengthy loading times (which appear to be a part of the game) and frequent crashes which really hurt the immersion into the journey of Freq (these seem to have settled a bit).

As someone who purchased the game solely for the MyCareer mode I have now given it enough of a go after 11 hours to say the basketball is fantastic
recommended:
soundtrack awesome and as such I can live with the terminally slow loading times (as slow as Ed Cowan was as Australian opener a few years back).

Playing a couple of high school and college games was pretty neat and I liked how the story mode through the first season kept player progression under control so Freq wasn't Rookie of the Year or an immediate All Star.

Having been drafted at #13 by the Suns
hoursPlayed: my Albert "Freq" Timmerman enjoyed free agency negotiations and is now fighting to get his minutes up at the Bucks (getting 21 mpg at present and climbing along with his stats).\n\nWhile I'll enjoy working on Freq
voteText: I will have to check out some other game modes now too :)"

reviewText:
Running it with an fx-8350 and an R9 380 at max settings, haven't had any frame rate drops at all, the audio has moments during games where it seems like it's been put through a bitcrusher, but it usually doesn't last for more than a second or two so it's not a big negative.

Pros:
Gameplay is extremely fluid, no more running past clunky defenders, earn your baskets.
When you score, you actually feel good about yourself.
Post play has been improved greatly, animations are smoother and believable.
Animations in general have been greatly improved.
As someone who generally dislikes most of the musical tracks in the NBA games, I don't find myself wanting to mute it anytime the music starts playing, so I guess that's a plus.
The be a coach mode or whatever has also received an overhaul and is very deep in terms of choices and gameplay.
Stadiums look really really nice
The rim moves when you dunk... Sometimes.
Your MYPlayer actually looks like he could be based off of a real person and not some ♥♥♥♥ed up generic clone.


Cons:
The story in MYCareer mode is VERY CHEESY, not enough for me to dislike the game, but enough to be mentioned as a con.
Though animations have been improved, there are a couple contact-shot animations near the basket that could use some work.
Haven't received my bonus VC yet for the pre-order, I heard that I'll be able to get it when the game officially releases on the 29th. How come the console peasants get their Bonus now??? Yes, I'm salty.



OVERALL- The game has improved substantially over the last few years, both in terms of animations and graphical detail. I'll give it a 9/10 and definitely would reccomend it to those of you who haven't yet pulled the trigger on it.

reviewText: I don't really get why this game has so many negative reviews, cause personally I think this game is just another addition to the NBA 2K series, nothing more, nothing less. The servers have definitely improved but we'll need to wait till the official release to say more. Currently, the game is really all it needs to be to take down NBA Live 16, and yes, it's worth the $60 if you don't have NBA 2K15. If you do, however, the only reason to buy it is if you want to enjoy the new ProAM mode or the story mode in MyCareer. If you're not a basketball fan, I don't really see why you'd buy NBA 2K but yes, it is a great game overall.

reviewText:
Here is my thoughts on the game as of two main gamemodes as in the MyGM gamemode and the MyCareer Gamemode


MyGM:

I felt like the MyGM mode was fairly good and very refreshing for a gamemode that has been the same and kind of needed a new thing added to it. The team relocation is a great addition, but is very hard to do and you need to play for a long time to get enough salary to even have the oppurtunity to do the relocation. So if you have the time to do 4-5 seasons and be able to complete the goals then you will be fine. But if you only do anything below the 4-5 seasons then the MyGM mode is mainly the same with only a new layout and 3-team trades to go along with it.

MyCareer:

They add highschool, college, and you get a story through the first year in the NBA. What could go wrong? That you play 15 games, 3 being 3 minute quarters, and then watch a movie for the rest of the time having no control when if it is really your life and options then you should be able to choose like you could in NBA 2K15. But this is really sad to see because they advertise it as a game where you can choose your story and life.......in reality you can't.

NBA 2K15 - 7/10

Get it on sale, not for full price.

reviewText:
I am going to say that 2K16 has the best presentation in terms of crowds, pre-game show, post-game show, and other stuff. The graphics look great too, but graphics are not everything. And this game is very unstable, network-wise as the game forces you to play online if you want to see actual and meaningful progress for your MyCareer (it started last year; you can play offline with limited experience; BS).

Anyway, server always crashes, and for one week, there would be atleast 2 me or my friend cannot connect through the network. This is disappointing as they release a huge patch which definitely improved the performance, but did not even fix some of the major problems like the commentator dropping out if you're playing with 6+ minute per quarter. Cannot play an online game with friend without us getting kicked off with no apparent reason, and many more.

If you will ever fix this game; please, fix it now or before the year ends.

Another thing is the MyCareer, I hate the first part of it. The story is unwanted, though I had wanted to start from HS to College and eventually to NBA, but you don't have to put some drama crap within it. You emphasize this game as my choice, but on the first part of the game mode, there is no choice whatsoever. Good thing I got passed it and finally enjoying a better MyCareer experience.

Don't buy it full price. Buy it when it's 33% or 50% off atleast.

EDIT AS OF 11/21/2015:
Yes, I will finally recommend this game to you guys. They finally fixed almost everything, finally, and finally. Though if you're not a hardcore fan, just wait for atleasst 33% off since the game may be really fun, but if you're looking for a total innovation, you won't really find it here, and MyCareer this year has been the cheesiest one so far (just the first year). If you can get this cheap, much better, if no, I must say it's now a decent game to play.

reviewText:
2k16 needs to fix this game, fast. Everyone I know over at the reddit.com/r/nba2k community agrees with me that the gameplay was made too difficult and that there are so many bugs in this game, this was by far the most sloppy release from 2k.

I've been playing NBA2K for years and this feels like the most unrefined version of NBA2K ever, especially on the PC version. Rampant hackers, terrible story mode, gameplay was tweaked to be 'realistic' aka my gold and purple players can't make wide-open shots half the time.. Kevin Durant missing from 17' out on non-user mode is blasphemy.

This is extremely dissapointing because NBA2K was originally made to be better than NBA Live, now EA is going to take advantage of NBA2K's miscue because their game had a terrible director (Spike Lee). The entire storeline is forced and feels borderline racist, as NBA2K doesn't seem to realize how diverse their audience is.

Go play NBA2K15, 2K games needs to fix this game and improve it. Their ticketing system looks like it's disabled because they're probably getting so many complaints.
voteText: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful

reviewText: Let me start off by saying that ALOT has changed. My first impressions were decent of this game. MyCareer is my favorite mode, and they managed to make it somewhat dissapointing. How? by pumping up your player to be the next Superstar, but making him worse than a d-league player. It takes some real hard work to earn VC, but the real pain is that they wave a lot of VC points in your face in exchange for money. That's the equivalent of waving a juicy steak in your face, while you are poor as dirt. You can take the steak and eat it on the spot, or work at a dead end job that pays you way less than minimum wage, but you will eventually have enough to buy that steak. Beware! fun to play but also frustrating like opening a jar of golden nuggets. Oh, and also lots of bugs. LOTS OF THEM. Gameplay is weird sometimes, but overall a 8/10.

reviewText:
Pros:  Customization in MyGM/MYLeague/MyTeam is awesome, you get to create anything your heart desires, Great TV-style presentation (Makes you feel like you are watching NBA on TNT), Game Modes (My personal favorite is My League), Great overall commentary, Graphics look really life-like

Cons: Frame-rate stuttering (although on my I3 and Intel HD graphics processor, it is very notiecable because with the high-end games the graphics are not as good), My Career is somewhat of a let-down considering I had high hopes for this mode.

Graphics: 9.5 out off 10
Audio 9 out of 10
Controls 8.5 out of 10
Overall Score 7.5 out of 10 (basically I lowered the score because of the my career mode)

IMO if you are a NBA fan and you only have a decent PC my advice is to buy this game RIGHT NOW or OTOH if you are a casual gamer or do not have a good PC my advice is to wait for a sale or to get a PS4 or XBOX 1 if you want this game!!!!

BTW, this is Becky's son (I'm the one that plays on this account)

reviewText:
For anyone on the fence about buying this game that enjoyed lasts years, Just buy it. I cant speak to the techinical problems that many others had regarding low frames in the menu and the like but as far as a basketball game this Is ROCK SOLID. The game is balanced extremely well and most of the exploits that you could use against AI have been fixed. I dont deal with people online so I cant speak to that experiance either, I just play offline and a lot of the MyGM and My Career modes. Speaking of my Career people are far to harsh on it. The first season is a write off as far as games/wins mattering and things like that but the story is pretty compelling and I find the acting and converstations far more believeable than anyhting 2K has written in the past. ONCE you get past the first year of your pro career (which consists of 8 games with story elements behind them) the game rolls into the traditional my career formula for the next years which is more or less the same as it was last year with one HUGE improvement.

Off days now matter you have limited time  to get your star to being what you'd envisioned as far as endorsements,  skills, fans and everything else. For the first time in a 2k game your Star doenst feel Ignored or like he's on the back burner. what I mean by that is that the ingame personalities Reconize your Greatness, often have pre game converstaions about the crazy string of tripple doubles you've put up or your incredible shooting streak!. thats awesome! I even had one situation where at half time blake griffen was talking about how difficult it was to stop my Athletic gard for legimate reasons, not just generic well hes really great player so hes difficult" its more taylord to what I do im a driving gaurd that shots a really high percentage from mid range so the converstaion was more about how difficult it is to gaurd me with the mid range shot. that is awesome I really feel like my player is the best player in the league and the league Reconizes it! that is a huge win in my opinion and has made me far more invested in my career.

Preformance:

for me the game is rock solid. I play it at 1440p and get anywhere from 100-130fps durring gameplay with all settings on High (supersampling on 1).

my system is :
i7-3770(non K)
GTX 980TI
game is running off a 500GB Samsung 850 evo SSD.

I recomend this game to anyone who really enjoyed last years game. Improved in every aspect for me and my Offline experiace has been awesome."

reviewText:
NBA 2k16 is not NEARLY as bad as all of these reviews describe. The two biggest issues being brought up are optimization, and Spike Lee’s “MyCareer” mode.

First of all, if your computer meets the system requirements, you can run all gameplay at a very smooth FPS. I have all graphic settings maxed and can run the game perfectly fine. The stuttering and lag being described in the reviews has ONLY occurred for me during the between-gameplay cutscenes, (introductions, timeouts, ect). While actually in game, everything runs better than ever, with smooth animations and high definition characters. The graphics are by far more superior to any previous installment.

2K decided to take a risk and use Spike Lee to write/direct the MyCareer mode. Like any other movie, Lee’s story centers around one character and his family. While you can make your character look any way you want, the story encourages you to be a young black man. If you don’t want to be black, you don’t have to be. It is not racist like some people say… it is just how the story is meant to be. Throughout 2K games, many people have hoped and wished that eventually they would have the choice to play through High School and College games. NBA 2K16 listened to its fans and delivered on this! Now everyone is complaining because it isn’t good enough… I on the other hand found that it complimented the story in a perfect amount of games (4 high school, 4 college). Between each game, the story progresses. The story itself is actually quite engaging! You feel emotion towards the characters IF you take the time to listen and watch the cut scenes. All in all, it is clear after completing the story (which I have) that Lee put in a lot of time and effort.

Here is the main point I wanted to make about MyCareer. If you absolutely hate what 2K has done by implementing a more complex story, DO NOT WORRY! After your first season in the NBA (you play 8 games your rookie year), the story aspect ends. At this point, you play just like you would in 2K15. Taking on full seasons, talking to the press, signing endorsements, increasing your stats, ect. All of this, along with even more!

With those two issues being pushed aside, there are many positives in NBA 2K16. The music is the best I have heard yet, finally landing on many good & popular tracks. The customization has drastically improved, and all of the best modes are there. 2K will be releasing bug fixes and updates, so all of these negative reviews will hopefully be changing. As for me, I find it the best installment in the series, and have enjoyed every minute I have played so far.

reviewText: Let me start off by saying that ALOT has changed. My first impressions were decent of this game. MyCareer is my favorite mode, and they managed to make it somewhat dissapointing. How? by pumping up your player to be the next Superstar, but making him worse than a d-league player. It takes some real hard work to earn VC, but the real pain is that they wave a lot of VC points in your face in exchange for money. That's the equivalent of waving a juicy steak in your face, while you are poor as dirt. You can take the steak and eat it on the spot, or work at a dead end job that pays you way less than minimum wage, but you will eventually have enough to buy that steak. Beware! fun to play but also frustrating like opening a jar of golden nuggets. Oh, and also lots of bugs. LOTS OF THEM. Gameplay is weird sometimes, but overall a 8/10.

reviewText:
2k16 needs to fix this game, fast. Everyone I know over at the reddit.com/r/nba2k community agrees with me that the gameplay was made too difficult and that there are so many bugs in this game, this was by far the most sloppy release from 2k.

I've been playing NBA2K for years and this feels like the most unrefined version of NBA2K ever, especially on the PC version. Rampant hackers, terrible story mode, gameplay was tweaked to be 'realistic' aka my gold and purple players can't make wide-open shots half the time.. Kevin Durant missing from 17' out on non-user mode is blasphemy.

This is extremely dissapointing because NBA2K was originally made to be better than NBA Live, now EA is going to take advantage of NBA2K's miscue because their game had a terrible director (Spike Lee). The entire storeline is forced and feels borderline racist, as NBA2K doesn't seem to realize how diverse their audience is.

Go play NBA2K15, 2K games needs to fix this game and improve it. Their ticketing system looks like it's disabled because they're probably getting so many complaints.
